By: Get News
October 31, 2025 at 10:18 AM EDT
$IQST Featured in Litchfield Hills Research Report with $18 price target on high-margin growth strategy
  • IQST Delivers Diversified Business with Divisions Focused on Telecommunications, Fintech, Electric Vehicles, Artificial Intelligence and More.
  • Partnership with Call Center in U.S. Health Services to Implement Next-Generation AI Solutions Using IQST Proprietary AI Technology.

  • Litchfield Hills Research Issues Recommendation and Detailed Report on IQSTEL (IQST) with $18 Price Target.

  • Completed Phase One of Next-Generation Cyber Defense Rollout with CYCU Partner Company.
  • Debt-Free Nasdaq Company with No Convertible Notes or Warrants and Plans to Give $500,000 in Shares as Dividend by the End of the Year.
  • Q2 Results: $17.41 Assets Per Share, Beating Metrics Including Net Shareholders' Equity, Gross Revenue, Gross Margin, Net Income, and Adjusted EBITDA
  • Launch of IQ2Call, Delivering Vertical AI-Telecom Integration to Target the $750B Global Market.
  • Equity Position Strengthened with $6.9 Million Debt Cut -- Almost $2 Per Share.


IQSTEL, Inc. (Nasdaq: IQST) offers cutting-edge solutions in Telecom, Fintech, Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence (AI), and Cybersecurity. Operating in 21 countries, IQST delivers high-value, high-margin services to its extensive global customer base. IQST projects $340 million in revenue for FY-2025, building on its strong business platform.

$73.6 Million Multi-Year Backlog and Florida State Term Contract Drive Momentum for AI-Cybersecurity Pioneer: Cycurion, Inc. (N A S D A Q: CYCU) $CYCU

By: PRLog
October 31, 2025 at 12:55 PM EDT
Cycurion, Inc. (N A S D A Q: CYCU) $CYCU Just Completed Restructuring Resulting in a Very Attractive OS Count of 2.88 Million Supporting Continued NASDAQ Listing and Higher Access to Institutional Investors

MCLEAN, Va. - Oct. 31, 2025 - PRLog -- N A S D A Q-listed AI-driven cybersecurity innovator Cycurion, Inc. (N A S D A Q: CYCU) $CYCU is making significant strides toward long-term growth and profitability, powered by a record-breaking $73.6 million multi-year backlog, new government contracts, and a transformative restructuring that positions the Company for institutional investor engagement and sustained N A S D A Q compliance.

A New Era for AI-Powered Cybersecurity

With global cyber threats intensifying across government and enterprise sectors, Cycurion's proprietary AI-infused ARx and Cyber Shield platforms deliver next-generation protection through a multi-layered SaaS model designed to prevent, detect, and neutralize threats in real time. The Company's technology is being adopted by some of the world's most demanding clients—including the U.S. Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, Defense Intelligence Agency, and U.S. Navy, as well as leading Fortune 100 and 500 corporations.

Founded by internet pioneer Emmit McHenry, who helped develop the first internet protocols and the creation of ".com" domains, Cycurion has deep roots in the digital evolution. Under the leadership of Chairman and CEO L. Kevin Kelly, the Company is leveraging advanced AI and machine learning to redefine cybersecurity through predictive threat intelligence and data-driven automation.

Florida State Term Contract: A Major Government Win

On October 29, 2025, Cycurion was selected as an approved vendor under the Florida State Term Contract for Information Technology (IT) Staff Augmentation Services, marking a major milestone in the Company's government sector expansion.
This multi-year contract allows Cycurion to deploy top-tier IT and cybersecurity professionals directly to Florida state agencies, counties, and municipalities—without competitive rebidding—covering services across AI integration, cloud engineering, cybersecurity, data analytics, and project management.

This strategic win positions Cycurion at the forefront of Florida's IT modernization initiative, while creating new recurring revenue opportunities that reinforce its long-term growth trajectory.

Record $73.6 Million Backlog Underpins Growth Visibility

Cycurion's backlog has surged to a record $73.6 million, spanning multi-year agreements with federal, state, local, and private sector clients. This includes over $8 million in new contracts secured in Q2 2025 alone, such as a $6 million municipal transportation agency contract for AI-powered cybersecurity and IT modernization, and an additional $4.6 million in new awards across healthcare and public safety.

The Company's growing AI-driven service portfolio has boosted its annualized revenue run-rate to $16 million, while the backlog provides more than 18 months of forward revenue visibility—a key metric for institutional investors seeking stability and scalability.

AI Meets Cybersecurity: Expanding Margins and Recurring Revenue

Cycurion's flagship ARx platform has been in development for over five years and is now being commercialized across government and enterprise clients. Its AI-based predictive threat mitigation and multi-layer protection create a recurring revenue model with expanding gross margins, setting the stage for robust profitability in 2026 and beyond.

The Company is currently having its ARx intellectual property independently valued, a process

Operational Technology Security Market Size by Type & Application Expected to Surge from USD 15.25 billion in 2026 to USD 35.50 billion by 2033

10-31-2025 07:27 PM CET | IT, New Media & Software

Press release from: Market Research Intellect

New Jersey, US State: "The global Operational Technology Security market in the Information Technology and Telecom category is projected to reach USD 35.50 billion by 2031, growing at a CAGR of 12.5% from 2025 to 2031. With rising industrial adoption and continuous innovation in Information Technology and Telecom applications, the market is estimated to hit USD 15.25 billion in 2024, highlighting strong growth potential throughout the forecast period."

The global Operational Technology (OT) Security market is projected to experience substantial growth by 2031, driven by increasing cyber threats targeting critical infrastructure and industrial control systems. OT security encompasses solutions and services designed to protect industrial networks, SCADA systems, and IoT-enabled devices from cyberattacks, unauthorized access, and operational disruptions. With industries such as manufacturing, energy, transportation, and utilities heavily relying on connected technologies, the demand for robust security measures to ensure system integrity, safety, and compliance is rising rapidly.

Advancements in threat intelligence, AI-based monitoring, intrusion detection, and risk management solutions are enhancing the effectiveness of OT security frameworks. The market growth is further supported by stringent regulatory requirements, rising adoption of Industry 4.0 technologies, and increasing awareness of cybersecurity risks in operational environments. By 2031, the Operational Technology Security market is expected to witness widespread deployment of integrated security solutions, strategic investments by industrial enterprises, and a focus on proactive risk mitigation, driving significant market expansion globally.

Key Players in the Operational Technology Security Market

Siemens AG
Cisco Systems Inc.

ABB Ltd.
McAfee LLC
Palo Alto Networks Inc.

item.title: No Credit Check Loans for Low Credit Scores: RadCred's AI
item.description:
Accessibility: Skip TopNav

No Credit Check Loans for Low Credit Scores: RadCred's AI Loan Matching Brings Instant Relief to Borrowers with Bad Credit

October 31, 2025 10:56 ET  | Source: Radcred Radcred

Glendale,CA, Oct. 31, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Federal Reserve data confirms 48% of American loan applicants face rejection in 2025, forcing millions toward predatory payday lenders charging 400-600% APRs. RadCred, America's first AI-powered loan matching platform, announces breakthrough results: an 87% approval rate for bad credit borrowers through instant AI evaluation of 112 alternative data points beyond FICO scores. The platform processed 99,000+ applications in Q3 2025, connecting 76,000+ borrowers with licensed lenders offering same-day funding and transparent terms through soft credit checks, preserving credit scores. This release examines surging demand, RadCred's technology, benefits, application processes, and the future of inclusive lending.

The Crisis Behind the Numbers: Why 48% of American Borrowers Face Loan Rejection

Federal Reserve surveys show loan rejection rates stabilized at 48% throughout 2025, with bad credit borrowers facing automatic declines regardless of current income or employment stability. This rigid FICO-dependent underwriting excludes 45 million Americans, 16% of adults, from mainstream credit markets.

Populations hardest hit include gig workers with irregular income, recent graduates building credit histories, single parents recovering from medical debt, and minorities facing documented lending discrimination. The Federal Reserve's Consumer Credit Panel reveals that "discouraged borrowers" avoiding applications despite genuine needs remain at 7.2% as of June 2025, well above pre-pandemic norms.

Rejected borrowers often resort to predatory payday lenders with 400-600% APRs, creating debt traps rather than solving emergencies. This exclusion threatens employment when car repairs go unfunded, endangers housing when rent shortfalls trigger evictions, and delays medical care when bills exceed savings.

The Demand for No Credit Check Personal Loans in 2025

Search volume for "no credit check personal loans" surged 215% year-over-year according to Google Trends, while alternative lending platforms processed a record 12 million quarterly applications, up 38% from 2024. Multiple factors drive this acceleration: Federal Reserve rates maintaining borrowing costs near 4%, persistent inflation straining household budgets, and gig economy expansion creating income volatility that traditional underwriting fails to accommodate.

A New Benchmark for U.S. Compliance: BTCNEX’s Global Regulatory System

By: Binary News Network
October 31, 2025 at 06:00 AM EDT

Meta Title: BTCNEX｜U.S. Compliance Registration and FinCEN MSB License Building a Globally Trusted Digital Asset Platform

Meta Description: Through registration in the State of Colorado, IRS EIN filing, and FinCEN MSB licensing, BTCNEX establishes a global compliance framework to provide investors with a safe, transparent, and trustworthy digital-asset trading environment—setting a new benchmark under international regulatory regimes.

The Trust Imperative in Global Crypto: Compliance Is the Only Key to the Future

In today’s rapidly advancing crypto-finance landscape, “compliance” has become the core indicator of whether an exchange can survive long term and earn trust. As countries such as the United States, Korea, and Singapore strengthen regulatory transparency, BTCNEX has taken the lead in building a solid legal and compliance foundation—from corporate registration to tax filing, from the MSB financial license to an AML framework—fully aligned with international regulatory standards.

Officially Registered in the United States: BTCNEX’s Legal Entity and Corporate Identity

BTCNEX Global Exchange Ltd. was officially incorporated in the State of Colorado on September 7, 2025, under registration number 20251981542 as a Profit Corporation. The registered office is 777 S Figueroa St, Los Angeles, CA 90017, USA. Authorized capital is USD 1,000,000 with 1,000,000 shares of common stock, and Jonathan Alexander Forrest Hannay serves as CEO, CFO, Secretary, and sole director.

IRS Tax Filing and EIN Certification: The Foundational Condition for Compliant Operations

On September 8, 2025, the U.S. Internal Revenue Service (IRS) issued BTCNEX a Federal Employer Identification Number (EIN: 39-4201585), a core credential enabling lawful participation in financial, tax, and cross-border activities in the U.S. The EIN filing reflects BTCNEX’s transparency and marks the international standardization of its tax credit and financial responsibility.

FinCEN MSB License: The Core Pillar of BTCNEX’s Compliance Landscape

On September 9, 2025, BTCNEX was granted an MSB (Money Services Business) license by the U.S. Department of the Treasury’s Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN), registration number 31000309792604. The license—under BTCNEX Global Exchange Ltd.—covers digital currency exchange, foreign exchange, prepaid product issuance, and money order sales, with coverage across all 50 U.S. states and territories.

Multi-Layer Defense and Audit Mechanisms: Dual Safeguards of Technology and Governance

Beyond compliance, BTCNEX has introduced AI-driven risk controls and multi-layer encryption, including AI trade monitoring, an AML/KYC intelligence engine, an independent audit team, and AES-256 data encryption.

From Compliance to Trust: BTCNEX’s International Brand Positioning

With its U.S. registered entity and the FinCEN supervisory framework, BTCNEX not only gains access to the international financial system but a

item.title: Bitpanda launches in the UK with the largest cryptoasset offering in the market | Crypto Insider Review
item.description:
Crypto Insider Review "THINK GLOBALLY, READ LOCALLY"
SEE OTHER BRANDS

Global take on cryptocurrencies news

Questions? +1 (202) 335-9303 | Contact
Submit Press Release
Latest News Press Releases
Submit Press Release

Bitpanda launches in the UK with the largest cryptoasset offering in the market

LONDON, UNITED KINGDOM, October 31, 2025 /EINPresswire.com/ -- Bitpanda, Europe's leading cryptoasset platform, has launched in the UK, giving British investors access to more than 600 cryptoassets - the most complete cryptoasset offering in the UK market.

With more than 7 million registered users across Europe, Bitpanda is recognised as one of Europe's most secure and established cryptoasset platforms. Now,

item.title: Error
Error
United States Managed Services Forecast Report 2025: A
item.description:
Accessibility: Skip TopNav

United States Managed Services Forecast Report 2025: A $165.61 Billion Market by 2033, Driven by Rising Cloud Adoption, Demand for Optimal IT Solutions, and Focus on Operational Efficiency

The United States Managed Services Market is projected to grow from USD 84.03 billion in 2024 to USD 165.61 billion by 2033, driven by a 7.83% CAGR. This expansion is fueled by rising IT demand, cloud adoption, and economic efficiency drives. Managed services, including network management, data backup, and security services, enable businesses to focus on core operations while handling IT needs externally. The trend is further accelerated by remote work and increasing cybersecurity threats. Major sectors embracing managed services include healthcare, retail, and large enterprises, with California, New York, and Washington being key adoption hubs.

October 30, 2025 08:03 ET  | Source: Research and Markets Research and Markets

Dublin, Oct. 30, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The "United States Managed Services Market Report by Type, Size of Enterprise, End User, Deployment, States and Company Analysis, 2025-2033" report has been added to ResearchAndMarkets.com's offering.

The United States Managed Services Market is expected to expand appreciably, from US$ 84.03 billion in 2024 to US$ 165.61 billion in 2033, at a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 7.83% over the forecast period of 2025-2033

This expansion is fueled by growing demand for optimal IT solutions, expansion of cloud usage, and cost-cutting measures among organizations interested in managed service providers to improve operational efficiency.



Managed services are defined as outsourcing some of the IT functions and tasks to a professional service provider, or in other terms, a Managed Services Provider (MSP). Through this, organizations are able to concentrate on their core business activities while leaving their IT requirements to professionals. Typical manage

item.title: Global File Recovery Software Market Outlook 2026-2033: Key
item.description:
• PR-Wiki
  • Imprint
  • Categories
    Advertising, Media Consulting, Marketing Research Arts & Culture Associations & Organizations Business, Economy, Finances, Banking & Insurance Energy & Environment Fashion, Lifestyle, Trends Health & Medicine Industry, Real Estate & Construction IT, New Media & Software Leisure, Entertainment, Miscellaneous Logistics & Transport Media & Telecommunications Politics, Law & Society Science & Education Sports Tourism, Cars, Traffic RSS-Newsfeeds

    About / FAQ Newsletter Terms & Conditions Privacy Policy Imprint
Press release

Global File Recovery Software Market Outlook 2026-2033: Key Type and Application Segments Fuel 9.5% CAGR Growth

10-30-2025 12:50 PM CET | IT, New Media & Software

Press release from: Market Research Intellect

File Recovery Software Market

New Jersey, US State: "The global File Recovery Software market in the Information Technology and Telecom category is projected to reach USD 3.2 billion by 2031, growing at a CAGR of 9.5% from 2025 to 2031. With rising industrial adoption and continuous innovation in Information Technology and Telecom applications, the market is estimated to hit USD 1.5 billion in 2024, highlighting strong growth potential throughout the forecast period."

File Recovery Software Market Size & Forecast 2031
The File Recovery Software market is growing steadily as data loss incidents increase due to hardware failures, cyberattacks, and accidental deletions across personal and enterprise environments. Rising reliance on digital storage devices and cloud computing has heightened the need for reliable recovery tools that ensure data integrity and minimize downtime. Advanced recovery solutions now support SSDs, RAID systems, and encrypted drives, offering users greater flexibility and precision. The growing adoption of AI and machine learning is improving scan accuracy and recovery speed, enhancing user experience and recovery success rates. Enterprises are integrating file recovery tools within broader data protection frameworks to ensure compliance and continuity. By 2031, expanding digital footprints, rising data volumes, and growing awareness of data recovery importance are expected to drive sustained market growth across global sectors, including IT, finance, healthcare, and media.

Increased digital transformation and the proliferation of endpoint devices are fueling the demand for cross-platform file recovery software capable of operating across Windows, macOS, Linux, and mobile systems. Vendors are focusing on cloud-based recovery services that provide remote access, scalable storage, and automated backup integration. The market is also benefiting from rising small and medium business adoption as cost-effective solutions become available through subscription models. Enhanced encryption, cybersecurity integration, and compliance-ready features are making recovery tools vital for regulated industries. The emergence of blockchain and distributed ledger technologies is further improving data traceability and authenticity during recovery processes. By 2031, the market is projected to evolve toward intelligent, automated recovery ecosystems powered by AI-driven diagnostics and predictive failure analysis, enabling faster, more secure, and efficient restoration of critical digital assets worldwide.

Key Players in the File Recovery Software Market

EaseUS
Recuva
Stellar Data Recovery
Disk Drill
Wondershare
Ontrack
Acronis
R-Studio
MiniTool
Wondershare

For Further Detail, Download the Sample PDF with Complete TOC, Table

TRADEWINDS NETWORKS WINS 2025 MOBILE BREAKTHROUGH AWARD FOR SOCIAL IMPACT

Private-Sector Broadband Pioneer Redefines Digital Equity and Smart Infrastructure as

Federal Programs Stall

Los Angeles, CA – October 29, 2025 – Tradewinds Networks, Inc., a leader in community-owned broadband and AI-driven cybersecurity, today announced it has been named the winner of the 2025 Mobile Breakthrough Award for Social Impact, recognizing its groundbreaking Owner-Hosted Community Network (OHCN) model and GuardTower zero-noise cybersecurity platform for delivering measurable digital equity and secure connectivity where federal programs have failed to reach.

The Mobile Breakthrough Awards, one of the mobile industry’s most prestigious global honors, celebrates companies driving innovation in 5G, broadband, IoT, and social impact. Tradewinds Networks was selected for its transformational role in connecting underserved communities through privately financed community-owned broadband ecosystems – built without reliance on government subsidies.

“Tradewinds Networks is building what incumbents won’t and what rivals can’t,” said John Santoyo, CEO of Tradewinds Networks. “While BEAD stops at the city limit and the ACP program collapsed under political pressure, Tradewinds’ privately financed model is expanding secure connectivity, creating jobs, and generating wealth where it’s needed most.”

Breaking the Dependency Cycle: Private Innovation Where Federal Programs Fail

The 2025 Mobile Breakthrough Award comes amid a dramatic realignment in the broadband landscape:

  • The Affordable Connectivity Program (ACP) expired June 1, 2024, leaving millions of Americans disconnected, including low-income, seniors, veterans and students.
  • The BEAD program, once promoted as a universal broadband solution, has stalled at city boundaries and slowed by regulatory red tape.

Tradewinds Networks has rewritten that playbook. Its Owner-Hosted Community Network (OHCN) empowers property owners, municipalities, and anchor institutions to own and monetize their broadband infrastructure—transforming passive consumers into digital asset owners.

Each OHCN node integrates:

  • Dell Technologies edge compute,
  • Intel-optimized processors,
  • Crown Castle private 5G backhaul, and
  • GuardTower deception-driven, zero-noise cybersecurity, providing 99.97% uptime, sub–1-second threat detection, and 10–15% local revenue share—without a single federal dollar.

Opportunity Zone Funds and Impact Investors Take Note

The Tradewinds Networks model is tailor-made for Opportunity Zone (OZ) funds, impact investors, and ESG-aligned portfolios seeking measurable, asset-backed social returns.

Tradewinds delivers:

  • Deployments beyond city limits into rural and economically distressed tracts ignored by BEAD.
  • Verifiable financial returns via community-owned broadband networks with

Press release

Emerging Trends in Enterprise Network Communications Equipment And US Market by Type and Application to Drive Valuation from USD 50 billion to USD 75 billion by 2033

10-29-2025 07:40 PM CET | Aerospace & Defense

Press release from: Market Research Intellect

New Jersey, US State: "The global Enterprise Network Communications Equipment And US market in the Information Technology and Telecom category is projected to reach USD 75 billion by 2031, growing at a CAGR of 5.5% from 2025 to 2031. With rising industrial adoption and continuous innovation in Information Technology and Telecom applications, the market is estimated to hit USD 50 billion in 2024, highlighting strong growth potential throughout the forecast period."

Enterprise Network Communications Equipment And US Market Size & Forecast 2031
The Enterprise Network Communications Equipment market in the US is expected to grow significantly by 2031, driven by the increasing need for high-speed connectivity, reliable data transmission, and advanced network infrastructure in businesses. Organizations are investing in next-generation routers, switches, and wireless access points to support cloud computing, IoT integration, and digital transformation initiatives. The adoption of 5G technology, software-defined networking, and network automation is further accelerating market growth, enabling enterprises to enhance operational efficiency and reduce downtime. Demand for secure, scalable, and energy-efficient equipment is becoming a key focus for IT departments across various sectors.

By 2031, the US Enterprise Network Communications Equipment market is projected to benefit from the growing trend of hybrid work environments and data-driven operations. Enterprises are increasingly deploying unified communication solutions and advanced network management systems to ensure seamless connectivity and robust cybersecurity. Vendors are focusing on developing intelligent, adaptable, and cost-effective solutions to meet the evolving requirements of large and medium-sized organizations. Continuous innovation in networking technologies, combined with rising enterprise investments in IT infrastructure modernization, is expected to drive sustained market expansion throughout the forecast period.

Key Players in the Enterprise Network Communications Equipment And US Market

Cisco Systems
Juniper Networks
Hewlett Packard Enterprise
Arista Networks
Extreme Networks
Dell Technologies
Mikrotik
Avaya
Fortinet
Netgear
TP-Link


For Further Detail, Download the Sample PDF with Complete TOC, Tables, Figures, Charts, And More @ https://www.marketresearchintellect.com/download-sample/?rid=1013371&utm_source=OpenPr-Oct&utm_medium=047

Canadian retiree earns $7,600 a day in stable passive income using Sol(Solana) mining

By: TheNewswire.com
October 29, 2025 at 10:10 AM EDT

TORONTO—With inflation continuing to rise and traditional savings rates low, Canadian retirees are actively seeking new ways to grow their wealth. A growing number of Canadian retirees are participating in regulated cloud mining projects using SOL (Solana) through Find Mining, easily earning up to $7,600 in stable passive income daily. This trend signals that digital asset investment is becoming a new direction for retirement wealth management.


Click Image To View Full Size

Compliance, security, and transparency make Find Mining the trusted choice for Canadian investors.

Find Mining is a global crypto mining service provider headquartered in London, regulated by the UK Financial Conduct Authority. The platform is committed to providing legal, compliant, secure, and transparent cloud mining services to global investors, enabling them to easily earn passive income without complex equipment or specialized technical expertise.

Find Mining has also received PwC's annual security certification and is backed by Lloyd's of London's insured digital asset custody. Furthermore, the platform utilizes Cloudflare's enterprise-grade firewall and McAfee's cloud security certification system, ensuring 99.99% system stability and a zero-security incident record.

Find Mining CEO Ibrahim Aydin said:

"We founded Find Mining to enable ordinary investors, especially retirees, to generate stable passive income in a secure, regulated environment. Solana (SOL) provides the ideal foundation for efficient and sustainable cloud mining, and we are making wealth growth easier and more transparent."

SOL (Solana): A combination of efficiency and stability

Solana is one of the fastest-growing blockchains in the world, renowned for its ultra-fast transaction speeds and low fees. Find Mining integrates Solana's computing power into its own mining pool, allowing holders to automatically participate in block verification and revenue distribution without any technical intervention.

Using Find Mining's AI-powered intelligent computing system, Solana's mining efficiency is over 42% higher than traditional cloud mining, providing stable returns with minimal risk. This method is not only environmentally friendly and energy-efficient, but also provides investors with truly "round-the-clock returns."

Real experiences of Canadian retirees

Richard Evans, a 67-year-old retired financial advisor from Vancouver, tried cloud mining with Sol (SOLANA) through Find Mining after retiring last year. He now earns about $7,600 per day.

"I used to invest in funds and stocks, but the market was too volatile. Find Mining is different; it's compliant, secure, and insured. Every morning, I open my account and see my profits automatically deposited into my account. This gives me more peace of mind than my pension."

$73.6 Million in Order Backlog Poised for Explosive Growth in 2026; Streamlined Share Structure: Cycurion, Inc. (N A S D A Q: CYCU) $CYCU

By: PRLog
October 28, 2025 at 13:11 PM EDT
AI-Driven Cybersecurity Innovator Cycurion, Inc. (N A S D A Q: CYCU) $CYCU Strengthens Balance Sheet, Expands Federal & Fortune 500 Partnerships, and Realigns for Institutional Investment

MCLEAN, Va. - Oct. 28, 2025 - PRLog -- Cycurion, Inc. (N A S D A Q: CYCU) a leading provider of AI-powered cybersecurity and IT solutions serving government and enterprise clients worldwide, today announced record progress on its transformation and growth strategy — positioning the company for a breakout year in 2026.

The company's $73.6 million contracted backlog, spanning 1–5 year agreements across both government and private sectors, underscores surging demand for Cycurion's proprietary AI-infused cybersecurity platforms and marks the foundation for accelerating recurring revenue and margin expansion in the coming year.

Key Highlights
  • $73.6 Million Backlog: Multi-year agreements across government, defense, and healthcare sectors provide more than 18 months of revenue visibility.
  • Attractive Share Structure: Following an October 27th one-for-thirty reverse split, CYCU now has only 2.88 million shares outstanding, enhancing liquidity and aligning with Nasdaq institutional investment thresholds.
  • Debt Reduction: CYCU reduced debt by $3.2 million through strategic conversions, strengthening its balance sheet and positioning for growth.
  • Strong Balance Sheet: $10.4 million in stockholders' equity and access to a $60 million equity line of credit (with $45 million available).
  • Blue-Chip Client Base: U.S. Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, Defense Intelligence Agency, U.S. Navy, and numerous Fortune 100 and 500 clients.
  • AI-Driven Growth: Proprietary ARx and Cyber Shield platforms are redefining modern cybersecurity through real-time AI threat detection and predictive protection.
  • Strategic Expansion: Active acquisition strategy enhances AI capabilities and expands market reach in North America and Latin America.

A Record Backlog Powered by AI Innovation

Cycurion's AI-enhanced ARx platform has fueled an unprecedented $73.6 million backlog, reflecting accelerating demand across key industries. Recent awards include a $6 million contract with a major U.S. transportation agency and additional $4.6 million in new government and healthcare contracts, representing a significant boost to CYCU's 2025 revenue base.

This growth builds on a $16 million annualized revenue run-rate, independent of the backlog, providing a solid foundation for sustained top-line expansion. The ARx platform — in development for over five years — is now being rolled out broadly across CYCU's client network, enabling recurring revenue and high-margin performance heading into 2026.

Trusted Partnerships with Leading Institutions

CYCU's credibility and proven performance continue to attract top-tier clients and partners. The company serves mission-critical agencies and enterprises, including:
  • U.S. Department of Defense
  • Department of Homeland Security
  • Defense Intelligence Agency
  • U.S. Navy
  • Fortune 100 & 500 corporations

Additionally, Cycurion's partnerships with healthcare organizations affiliated with the National Association of County and City Health Officials (NACCHO) extend its reach into a $3 billion+ cybersecurity market. CYCU's NACCHO Cyber Shield program alone is expected to deliver $1.8 million in first-year revenue.

Strategic Acquisitions Fueling AI Leadership

Cycurion's disciplined acquisition strategy continues to accelerate both innovation and market expansion. Subsidiaries including Axxum Technologies, Cloudburst Security, and Cycurion Inn

Global Ransomware Attacks Spike by Over A Quarter in September, After Months of Decline

  • Global ransomware volume increased by 28% in September, with 421 attacks
  • Qilin was the most active threat group, responsible for 14% (58) of attacks
  • Industrials remained the most targeted sector, experiencing 29% (120) of all attacks
  • Three quarters (75%) of attacks took place in North America and Europe
  • Despite the September surge, attacks in Q3 fell by 5% (1,125) compared to Q2 (1,180)

New research from NCC Group finds ransomware attacks have risen for the first time in six months, increasing by 28% month-on-month to 421 attacks. While overall attack volume remained below 500, the uptick may signal a renewed escalation heading into the year’s most active period for cyber criminals.

Industrials under fire

The Industrials sector continued to bear the brunt of ransomware activity, accounting for29% (120) of all attacks in September. Also, the most targeted sector for Q3, with 30% (342) of attacks, it’s clear that Industrials is a highly attractive target for cyber criminals, even as public attention remains on consumer-facing breaches.

Consumer Discretionary (which includes automotive manufacturers, retail businesses, and leisure facilities) followed with 76 attacks, while Financials moved to third place with 47 attacks. The continued targeting of financial institutions highlights attackers’ strategic focus on accessing financial data, and reflects a broader trend of ransomware campaigns to maximise monetary gain.

High-profile ransomware attacks target Europe

North America and Europe accounted for three quarters (75%) of all global attacks, amounting to 317 last month. Notably, the ransomware attack on major European airports led to significant disruption. Airlines were forced to switch to manual operations, which caused delays, cancellations, and passenger congestion. The attack is a stark reminder of the vulnerability of critical infrastructure.

Qilin dominates the ransomware landscape

Qilin led the pack in September, taking responsibility for 14% (58) of attacks. The group also remained the most prominent threat actor for the quarter, with 13% (151) of all attacks. Its focus on data-centric, financially lucrative, and supply-chain dependent industries – such as Industrials and Consumer Discretionary – suggests an intent to maximise operational disruption and leverage extortion.

Throughout the quarter, new groups, including The Gentlemen and Interlock, emerged. New players signal a shift in the threat landscape, where the smaller actors now leverage shared infrastructure and leaked builder kits to establish their scale. This demonstrates how the threat ecosystem continues to diversify and evolve.

Geopolitical spotlight

Geopolitical tensions in September intensified global cyber risks. China’s summit with non-Western leaders signalled a direct challenge to the US-led order, while Russian military drills and ransomware attacks on European airports exposed the rising threat of hybrid warfare. And in the Middle East, Israeli strikes in Qatar and growing recognition of Palestine further deepened international divisions. Together, these events highlight a volatile global landscape where ransomware and cyber operations are increasingly used as tools of strategic influence and disruption.

Matt Hull, head of Threat Intelligence at NCC Group, said: “From high-profile supply chain breaches and persistent ransomware activity, to the influence of geopolitical tensions on cyber operations, organizations are facing increasingly adaptive and sophisticated threat actors.

“The rise in attacks in September could

item.title: OmniIndex Launches Boudica Chat: The World’s Only Secure AI Solution Eliminating Data Exposure and Hallucinations - IssueWire
item.description:

Pdf whatsapp


OmniIndex Launches Boudica Chat: The World’s Only Secure AI Solution Eliminating Data Exposure and Hallucinations

Boudica Chat eliminates the 3 major risks associated with traditional LLMs: data leakage, hallucinations, and business blindness

  • Boudica Logo

  • Boudica AI Image

London, United Kingdom Oct 29, 2025 (Issuewire.com)  - OmniIndex today announced the launch of Boudica Chat, a revolutionary conversational AI engine designed specifically for businesses handling sensitive and regulated data. Boudica Chat is the first and only enterprise AI solution built on a Zero Data Trust framework, providing verifiable accuracy and absolute data control by eliminating the three major risks associated with traditional Large Language Models (LLMs): data leakage, hallucinations, and business blindness.

Traditional generative AI models pose unacceptable risks by exposing Proprietary Information and Personally Identifiable Information (PII) to external models and third parties. Boudica Chat removes this vulnerability entirely. It encrypts sensitive content in your files and data before analysis, and then only analyzes the encrypted data. Thus eliminating risk of exposure. 

The End of the AI Trust Gap.

Key Boudica Chat Differentiators:

Elimination of Data Exposure (Zero Data Trust): Data remains secured using FHE throughout its entire lifecycle. The AI analyzes the encrypted data in its encrypted state, creating reports and GenAI outputs without a "vulnerability window."

Verifiable Accuracy (No Hallucinations): Boudica Chat addresses the critical risk of AI hallucinations through its unique Small Language Model (SLM) Architecture. Unlike LLMs trained on vast, uncontrolled data, Boudica is trained on algorithms and strict rules and operates exclusively on small, controlled, client-specific datasets. It will only deliver an answer if it is verifiable and supported by the client’s authoritative encrypted data. If no answer exists, it returns an error rather than making one up.

Complete Control and Real-Time Context: The solution natively and securely connects to live data sources (including databases, Hubspot, and cloud storage) while processing remains encrypted, providing full context without the risk of migration or leakage.

"The future of enterprise AI demands absolute security and verifiable accuracy, but the inherent flaws of standard LLMs have created an 'AI Trust Gap' that stalls adoption in regulated industries," said Simon Bain, CEO of OmniIndex. "Boudica Chat is the strategic answer. By pioneering the use of Fully Homomorphic Encryption in a conversational interface, we have given businesses the power of GenAI with the confidence of absolute data protection and verifiable, non-hallucinated results."

Immediate Enterprise Applications

Boudica Chat is immediately available for high-compliance applications at boudi.ca, including:

Financial Fraud Analytics: Running real-time queries across encrypted customer transaction logs to maximize detection speed without ever exposing PII.

Confidential Legal Summarization: Instantly summarizing complex, proprietary case files and contracts using natural language, providing intelligence derived only from encrypted documents.

Proactive Threat Hunting: Querying encrypted server log files using a natural language interface to deliver immediate, actionable threat intelligence.

Adopting Boudica Chat is not merely a security measure; it is a strategic step towards seizing a competitive advantage in the new era of secure, private AI. Sign up today for a free personal account at https://boudi.ca/





Media Contact

OmniIndex matthew@omniindex.io 690 Saratoga Ave http://www.omniindex.io
Categories : Banking , Business , Finance , Insurance , Technology
Tags : Financial Services , Computing & Technology , Artificial Intelligence , AI , Cybersecurity , Technology , Regulatory , Homomorphic Encryption , Government/Public Policy , Product Launch

SharkStriker launches a new data center in Malaysia

October 29, 2025
We have launched a new PDPA and CSA-compliant data center in Malaysia. The data center will empower our customers with high-speed access to our localized compliance-centric managed services.
  • (1888PressRelease) October 29, 2025 - SharkStriker, a global cybersecurity vendor that specializes in human-led, tech-driven compliance-centric cybersecurity services, has launched a new data center in Malaysia.

    The new PDPA CSA-compliant data center will become a bedrock for efficient and quick operations, helping customer and partner organizations to bolster their security capabilities and enhance their compliance with regulations.

    It will enable SharkStriker to deliver localized compliance-centric managed cybersecurity services through its purpose-built platform STRIEGO, helping organizations to fend off threats and improve compliance.

    Over the years, Malaysia has witnessed a staggering increase in cyber threats that have toppled organizations from their operations, caused irrevocable financial losses, and tarnished years of reputation. In response to this, regulators have also tightened the regulations to enable organizations, especially critical infrastructure organizations and SMBs, to secure their infrastructure and data better.

    With STRIEGO locally hosted on a PDPA & CSA-compliant data center in Malaysia, organizations will be able to turbocharge their preparedness with localized threat detection, latency optimization, faster failover, and rapid disaster recovery. It will enable them to secure their data in line with local data protection guidelines through superior data management, access, and storage.

    They would be able to benefit from enhanced threat detection capabilities through instantaneous access to data and real-time multi-sourced threat intelligence. It will also enable SharkStriker to offer rapid incident response support to its customers and partners in Malaysia, helping them respond and recover from threats without any delay. Through a round-the-clock SOC team making use of security data contextualized with localized information on threats and vulnerabilities, organizations would swiftly detect and address security and compliance risks before they escalate into severe threats.

    It will serve as a catalyst for SharkStriker to boost the efficiency of services, including their SOC, SIEM-as-a-service, MDR, and compliance management services through increased availability and access to data.

    It brings the global cybersecurity vendor another step closer to its mission of helping organizations worldwide bridge their cybersecurity and compliance gaps through a blend of human excellence and cutting-edge technology.

    About SharkStriker
    SharkStriker is a global cybersecurity vendor that strives to help global organizations across industries secure their identities, infrastructure, operations, and people by blending human expertise with technological excellence.

    With its purpose-built platform and its team of cybersecurity and compliance experts, it is helping organizations solve some of the most immediate challenges from the rising cybersecurity skills gap, increased complexity and cost of solutions, limited visibility and control, and unrealized p

Clinical Trials Market Outlook 2035: Decentralization and Digital Integration

October 28, 2025 9:26 am - Clinical Trials Market Outlook 2035: Decentralization, Digital Integration, and Patient-Centric Evolution Driving Industry Expansion

The global clinical trials market, valued at US$ 64.7 billion in 2024, is projected to grow at a CAGR of 5.2% from 2025 to 2035, crossing US$ 112.9 billion by the end of 2035. This steady expansion underscores the sector's critical role in advancing medical innovation and translating scientific discovery into patient care.

With the healthcare ecosystem witnessing accelerated transformation — from digital enablement and AI-driven patient recruitment to decentralized and hybrid models — clinical trials have become the backbone of modern therapeutic development. Rising chronic disease prevalence, increasing focus on novel modalities such as cell and gene therapies, and the adoption of patient-centric and technology-enabled study models are shaping the industry’s growth trajectory.

Rising Demand Fueled by Chronic Disease Burden

The increasing prevalence of chronic and lifestyle-related diseases is a major driver for the clinical trials market. Conditions such as diabetes, cancer, cardiovascular disorders, and respiratory diseases continue to burden healthcare systems worldwide, driving the need for innovative therapies and clinical validation.

According to the World Health Organization (WHO), over 14% of adults aged 18 and above had diabetes in 2022, almost double the prevalence in 1990. Simultaneously, the Global Cancer Observatory reported over 19.9 million new cancer cases globally in 2022. These trends highlight the growing need for continuous therapeutic innovation.

Clinical trials provide the essential framework for assessing the safety, efficacy, and dosing of new interventions. Pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies are investing heavily in trial launches across diverse therapeutic classes, particularly in oncology and metabolic disorders. For instance, as of September 2025, more than 4,350 clinical trials are being conducted specifically for breast cancer treatment evaluation.

Focus on Novel and Advanced Therapies

The next decade will see an upsurge in clinical studies focused on cell-based, gene, and RNA-based therapies. As of September 2025, there are over 740 ongoing clinical trials for gene therapy and around 5,500 trials for cell therapy worldwide.

These advanced modalities require customized trial designs, tailored endpoints, and new regulatory frameworks. The success of mRNA-based vaccines during the COVID-19 pandemic has further accelerated confidence and investment in RNA-based therapeutics, paving the way for a surge in mRNA-focused clinical programs targeting infectious diseases, oncology, and rare genetic conditions.

As sponsors pivot toward precision medicine and personalized therapy models, biomarker-driven tri

Press release

Cybersecurity Ai Market Valuation Expected to Hit USD 112.5 billion by Key Players:CrowdStrike, Palo Alto Networks, McAfee

10-29-2025 12:48 PM CET | IT, New Media & Software

Press release from: Market Research Intellect

Cybersecurity Ai Market

New Jersey, US State: "The global Cybersecurity Ai market in the Information Technology and Telecom category is projected to reach USD 112.5 billion by 2031, growing at a CAGR of 12.5% from 2025 to 2031. With rising industrial adoption and continuous inOctation in Information Technology and Telecom applications, the market is estimated to hit USD 40.8 billion in 2024, highlighting strong growth potential throughout the forecast period."

Cybersecurity AI Market Size & Forecast 2031
The cybersecurity AI market is expected to witness strong growth through 2031, driven by the increasing complexity of cyber threats and the rising need for intelligent, automated defense systems. Artificial intelligence is being integrated into cybersecurity frameworks to enhance threat detection, incident response, and predictive analytics. AI-powered solutions can identify anomalies, detect zero-day attacks, and mitigate risks faster than traditional methods. The rapid digitalization of enterprises, expansion of cloud environments, and proliferation of connected devices are creating new vulnerabilities, fueling the adoption of AI-driven cybersecurity solutions. Machine learning algorithms are increasingly being used to strengthen network monitoring, fraud detection, and endpoint protection. Organizations are investing in adaptive security systems that evolve with emerging threats, minimizing manual intervention. The demand for real-time security analytics and automated remediation tools is further boosting market expansion across industries such as BFSI, IT, healthcare, and defense.

By 2031, the global cybersecurity AI market is projected to experience robust expansion supported by continuous innovation in deep learning and behavioral analytics technologies. North America leads the market due to early adoption of AI-based defense solutions and a strong presence of cybersecurity vendors, while Asia-Pacific is witnessing rapid growth driven by digital transformation and rising cybercrime incidents. Key players are focusing on developing scalable, cloud-based AI platforms that integrate seamlessly with existing security infrastructures. The growing focus on zero-trust architecture, automated threat intelligence, and AI-driven risk management is shaping the competitive landscape. Governments and enterprises are increasingly collaborating to strengthen cybersecurity frameworks through AI research and regulatory standards. By 2031, cybersecurity AI will be a cornerstone of digital defense strategies, empowering organizations to predict, prevent, and respond to evolving threats with speed, precision, and resilience in an increasingly connected world.

Key Players in the Cybersecurity Ai Market
CrowdStrike
Palo Alto Networks
McAfee
Cisco Systems
IBM
Check Point Software

Press release

Cloud Workload Security Market Growth Key Drivers to Push Valuation to USD 10.5 billion by Key Players:Palo Alto Networks, McAfee, Cisco Systems

10-29-2025 12:52 PM CET | IT, New Media & Software

Press release from: Market Research Intellect

Cloud Workload Security Market

New Jersey, US State: "The global Cloud Workload Security market in the Information Technology and Telecom category is projected to reach USD 10.5 billion by 2031, growing at a CAGR of 15.6% from 2025 to 2031. With rising industrial adoption and continuous inOctation in Information Technology and Telecom applications, the market is estimated to hit USD 3.4 billion in 2024, highlighting strong growth potential throughout the forecast period."

Cloud Workload Security Market Size & Forecast 2031
The cloud workload security market is projected to grow substantially through 2031, driven by the rapid adoption of cloud computing, containerization, and multi-cloud environments across enterprises. As organizations migrate critical workloads to the cloud, the need for advanced security solutions to protect applications, data, and virtual machines has intensified. Cloud workload security platforms enable visibility, compliance, and protection against evolving threats, ensuring consistent security policies across hybrid and distributed infrastructures. The increasing sophistication of cyberattacks and misconfigurations in cloud environments is fueling demand for automated and AI-driven security tools. Enterprises are adopting cloud-native security solutions with real-time monitoring, intrusion detection, and runtime protection capabilities. The rise of DevSecOps and continuous integration models has further reinforced the importance of embedding security throughout the application lifecycle. Growing awareness of regulatory compliance and data protection requirements continues to support global market expansion.

By 2031, the global cloud workload security market is expected to witness strong growth, supported by the proliferation of digital transformation initiatives and increased reliance on virtualized IT infrastructure. North America dominates the market due to advanced cloud adoption and strong cybersecurity frameworks, while Asia-Pacific is emerging as a high-growth region driven by accelerating enterprise digitalization. Vendors are focusing on delivering unified platforms that integrate identity management, threat intelligence, and security posture assessment for enhanced protection. The trend toward container orchestration and microservices architecture is creating opportunities for scalable, cloud-native security solutions. Competitive differentiation is shaped by automation, AI-based analytics, and compliance management features. Organizations are increasingly investing in proactive security approaches to safeguard mission-critical workloads from breaches and downtime. By 2031, cloud workload security will remain a fundamental component of enterprise defense strategies, ensuring operational resilience, compliance, and trust in the evolving cloud

Silverback AI Chatbot Launches Next-Generation AI Agents to Redefine Intelligent Automation

By: Press Advantage
October 28, 2025 at 14:39 PM EDT
New York, New York - October 28, 2025 - PRESSADVANTAGE -

Silverback AI Chatbot has announced the introduction of its next-generation AI Agents, a major advancement in conversational technology designed to transform how organizations automate communication, manage workflows, and deliver real-time support. The launch reflects the company’s long-term commitment to developing intelligent, ethical, and context-aware systems that bridge the gap between human intuition and machine efficiency. By blending data intelligence with natural conversation design, Silverback AI Chatbot positions itself at the forefront of the next phase of AI-driven engagement, where technology learns, adapts, and collaborates seamlessly across industries.

The newly launched Silverback AI Chatbot’s AI Agents represent the culmination of extensive research into adaptive automation and contextual understanding. These digital agents move beyond the limits of conventional chatbots, functioning as autonomous systems capable of interpreting intent, managing complex processes, and refining their performance through continuous learning. Each agent is designed to think and act with awareness combining advanced natural language processing (NLP) with machine learning to deliver accurate, relevant, and human-like responses in real time.

Unlike traditional conversational systems, which often depend on rigid scripting, Silverback AI Chatbot’s architecture empowers AI Agents to understand nuance and sentiment. This allows them to respond to diverse conversational styles, maintain continuity over extended interactions, and dynamically adjust tone according to user behavior. Whether assisting customers, guiding internal teams, or managing operational requests, the AI Agents provide consistent support across multiple channels from web chat and mobile apps to social media and enterprise platforms.

One of the defining characteristics of these AI Agents is their versatility. They are not confined to a single purpose but can operate across industries such as retail, healthcare, finance, logistics, and education. In an e-commerce setting, an agent can handle inquiries, track orders, and offer personalized recommendations. In a healthcare context, it can assist patients in booking appointments or provide guidance on service availability. Within corporations, the same system can serve as an internal assistant scheduling meetings, generating reports, and organizing workflows. This level of adaptability ensures that organizations of any size can deploy automation in ways that align with their specific needs and customer expectations.

At the technological core of these agents lies Silverback AI Chatbot’s commitment to interoperability. The AI Agents can integrate seamlessly with enterprise systems, including CRMs, ERP tools, and analytics dashboards through secure APIs. This allows for direct access to real-time data and process automation without disrupting existing infrastructures. For instance, a customer asking for shipment updates can trigger a data query within an ERP system, while a sales representative can request an instant analytics summary from the same conversational interface. The result is a unified digital environment that connects data, people, and processes under a single intelligent layer.

Security and data integrity remain central to Silverback AI Chatbot’s innovation philosophy. Every AI Agent operates under rigorous compliance frameworks aligned with GDPR, CCPA, and other international data protection standards. Clients have full control over how their data is accessed and processed, supported by transparent monitoring tools that document every AI interaction. This focus on ethical AI ensures that automation remains accountable, protecting both user trust and organizational integrity.

From a human experience perspective, Silverback AI Chatbot’s AI A

Benevity Report Reveals Confidence Gap Undermining the Effectiveness of Global Corporate Grantmaking

October 29, 2025 Jason Quintero

CALGARY, AB – 29/10/2025 – (SeaPRwire) – A new study from Benevity Impact Labs sheds light on a paradox at the heart of modern corporate philanthropy: while companies around the world are more committed than ever to making a difference through grantmaking, many lack the confidence to say they are doing it well. The report — The Grants Confidence Gap: Uncovering the Hidden Barriers to Effective Corporate Grantmaking — offers the first comprehensive, data-driven look into the psychological and strategic underpinnings of corporate social investment.

Drawing on responses from 120 global corporations, Benevity’s research shows that nearly three out of four organizations believe they are following best practices in grantmaking. Yet, barely half feel confident in their effectiveness. This “confidence gap,” according to Benevity’s Chief Impact Officer Sona Khosla, is not merely a soft metric; it represents a critical barrier that can undermine the credibility, reach, and long-term impact of corporate social responsibility (CSR) programs.

“Confidence is an invisible currency in philanthropy,” Khosla said. “It determines whether teams feel empowered to innovate, to build trust, and to make the difficult trade-offs that meaningful impact requires. The data tells us that many grantmakers have the will—but they are still searching for the way.”

A New Lens on Corporate Grantmaking

The study dissects the anatomy of a high-performing grantmaking program, examining four pillars—strategic alignment, stakeholder engagement, adaptability, and communication—and how organizations rate themselves in each. While the results point to widespread enthusiasm and institutional support for CSR, they also highlight a striking gap betw

Easy Dynamics Named 2025 NVTC Cyber50 Honoree
Press Release October 29, 2025
Recognition Highlights Company's Leadership in Cybersecurity, Innovation, and Excellence
Share This Story:
"I am thrilled to see the team recognized for their work delivering modern and effective cybersecurity solutions that address our nation's most critical security challenges." - Poupak Afshar, CEO

MCLEAN, VA, October 29, 2025 /24-7PressRelease/ -- Easy Dynamics (EZD) is pleased to announce they have been named a 2025 Cyber50 Award Honoree by the Northern Virginia Technology Council (NVTC). This recognition reinforces the company's reputation for innovation and leadership in advancing cybersecurity solutions that protect critical systems and data.

The NVTC Cyber50 Awards recognize the top 50 cybersecurity companies, government contractors, executives, and rising stars in the National Capital Region. Honorees were selected from more than 130 nominations through a rigorous evaluation process conducted by a panel of independent judges who assessed candidates based on three areas: innovation, impact, and leadership in cybersecurity.

"We are honored to be recognized as a 2025 NVTC Cyber50 honoree," said Poupak Afshar, CEO of Easy Dynamics. "I am thrilled to see the team recognized for their work delivering modern and effective cybersecurity solutions that address our nation's most critical security challenges. As we innovate in Zero Trust Architecture (ZTA), ICAM, and security automation, we always remain focused on our core mission: to design, build, and secure the systems that protect our people, places, and way of life."

EZD has established itself as a trusted partner in developing cybersecurity solutions for federal agencies of all sizes. The company provides clients with effective solutions that enhance their security posture, accelerate compliance and modernization efforts.

As the cybersecurity landscape continues to evolve with emerging threats and technological advancements, EZD remains committed to staying at the forefront of innovation. The NVTC Cyber50 recognition affirms the company's position as a leader in cybersecurity and underscores its ongoing dedication to protecting the digital infrastructure that powers our nation's critical operations.

About Easy Dynamics
Easy Dynamics is a leading technology services provider with a core focus in ICAM, Cloud Modernization, Risk Management, and Automation & Resiliency. We are builders, problem solvers, and trusted advisors who bring well-architected solutions and management consulting to our clients to align them with the best practices their missions demand. As industry leaders, we are committed to delivering unparalleled quality and service in all aspects of our organization and providing our customers with technical excellence and the business acumen needed to advise them on both tactical and strategic initiatives. Learn more at www.easydynamics.com.

About the Northern Virginia Technology Council (NVTC)
NVTC is where the region's tech community comes together. From bold startups to Fortune 100 giants, we represent 500 members across sectors shaping the future of technology. NVTC drives innovation, fosters connections, and advocates for policies that fuel growth and position Northern Virginia as a global leader in technology. Through its initiatives in cybersecurity, gen AI, cloud computing, and beyond, NVTC empowers the tech community to shape the future. Whether it's through policy advocacy, peer networks, or industry promotion, NVTC drives innovation that's transforming the world. Learn more at www.nvtc.org. 

# # #

Contact Information

Kelsey Caprio

Easy Dynamics

McLean, VA

United States

Telephone: 202.558.7275

Email: Email Us Here

Website: Visit Our Website

Blog: Visit Our Blog

Libraries Enter a New Era of Self-Service: EnvisionWare and ScannX Expand Partnership to Launch ScanPerfect MFP

October 29, 2025 Jason Quintero

ATLANTA, GA – 29/10/2025 – (SeaPRwire) – In a move signaling the evolution of library technology, EnvisionWare, a global leader in self-service and efficiency solutions for libraries, has announced a significant expansion of its long-standing partnership with ScannX, a pioneer in advanced book-scanning and digitization systems. The collaboration introduces a new generation of multifunction printers designed specifically for the modern public library, with the ScanPerfect® MFP standing as the centerpiece of this innovation. More than a printer, it represents a comprehensive bridge between digital and physical library workflows — enabling users to print, scan, save, and share information seamlessly from a single, intuitive device.

The ScanPerfect MFP will be made available through EnvisionWare’s Jamex product line, a trusted suite of self-service payment and printing solutions already used in thousands of libraries worldwide. This partnership marks a new phase in how libraries can deliver convenient and integrated technology experiences to their patrons while managing operational costs more efficiently.

For many libraries, document management has become a growing challenge — balancing the need for digital transformation with accessibility, affordability, and user-friendliness. The ScanPerfect MFP aims to solve these challenges head-on. By integrating fully with EnvisionWare’s suite of print management tools, including the well-established LPT:One™ and mobile printing solutions, the MFP allows patrons to perform multiple tasks from a single terminal. Whether users are printing from a smartphone, scanning archival materials, or securely storing files in the cloud, the experience remains consistent, fast, and library-

item.title: Red8 Achieves Recertification of SOC 2 Type II
item.description:
Accessibility: Skip TopNav

Red8 Achieves Recertification of SOC 2 Type II

Fourth Consecutive Certification Demonstrates Red8’s Consistent Excellence and Compliance with Critical Industry Standard for Security Controls

October 28, 2025 08:55 ET  | Source: Red8 Red8

BOSTON, Oct. 28, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Red8, the industry expert in architecting modern infrastructure, today announced that it has successfully achieved completion of the Service Organization Control (SOC) 2 Type II audit for a fourth consecutive year.

Developed in accordance with the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants’ (AICPA), the SOC 2 Type II compliance standard is a rigorous auditing procedure that evaluates a company’s operational controls relevant to security. Certification validates that the organization is managing client data securely, and in such a way that it protects the organization as well as the privacy of its clients.

Achieving certification validates that an organization manages client data securely and responsibly, protecting both the business and its customers.

“Maintaining SOC 2 Type II certification year after year is just one way that Red8 demonstrates its complete commitment to data protection and security,” said Frank Wiacek, President and CEO of Red8. “We have an important responsibility to our clients who trust us to safeguard their information and deliver optimal solutions that meet the highest compliance standards.”

Red8’s audit was performed by CPA firm Linford & Company LLP and included examination of its policies and procedures regarding the security of its infrastructure, software, people, data, and other relevant areas of the business. Following completion of the examination, Linford & Company delivered a final report with the results demonstrating that Red8’s policies and procedures meet the SOC 2 Type II certification criteria.

About Red8
Red8, a wholly owned company of Insight Investments, Corp., is an IT solutions provider dedicated to solving critical business challenges and creating strategic value through modern technology solutions and processes. Recognized for its engineering excellence and consulting leadership, Red8 is a trusted partner to many of the nation’s largest corporations––delivering comprehensive technology solutions around security, analytics, cloud and automation, endpoint, device lifecycle services, and data center infrastructure, delivered through consulting, staff augmentation, and managed services. For more information, visit www.Red8.com.

Market forecasts suggest continued expansion through 2031, fueled by the growing need for real-time intelligence and enhanced situational awareness. M42 AI Expands into Strategic Metals with Minority Investment in U.S. Resource Company, Advancing Domestic Critical Mineral Independence

October 28, 2025 Jason Quintero

DALLAS, TX – 28/10/2025 – (SeaPRwire) – As the global demand for rare earth and critical minerals accelerates amid growing geopolitical and technological competition, artificial intelligence is increasingly stepping into the mining sector to redefine how resources are found, valued, and extracted. In a move reflecting this convergence, Messier 42 LLC (“M42”), a privately held global AI and digital transformation company, announced it has entered into an agreement to acquire a minority stake in a privately developed polymetallic resource company located in the Western United States.

The unnamed mining company, which has spent more than six years advancing its operations, specializes in precious metals, rare earth elements, and critical minerals—resources that form the backbone of semiconductors, renewable energy systems, advanced defense platforms, and next-generation robotics. According to M42, the partnership not only represents a long-term strategic investment but also marks the first time the company’s proprietary Transformational AI platform will be deployed to accelerate and enhance the understanding of a major U.S. mineral deposit.

Through this alliance, M42’s artificial intelligence technologies will be used to non-invasively analyze and model sub-surface data, helping geologists and engineers locate, define, and optimize extraction of key resources with unprecedented precision. The AI-driven approach is designed to minimize environmental disruption while improving accuracy in identifying hi

SafeEdges India Partners with South Korea’s LeadPoint to Strengthen Blockchain and Cybersecurity Collaboration

The strategic partnership, signed during GITEX Global 2025 in Dubai, aims to enhance permissioned blockchain security and promote India–Korea cooperation in advanced cybersecurity and blockchain innovation.

  • KakaoTalk 20251020 082607194 10

Panna, Madhya Pradesh Oct 28, 2025 (Issuewire.com)  - SafeEdges India Signs Strategic Partnership with South Korea’s LeadPoint to Strengthen Blockchain and Cybersecurity Collaboration

SafeEdges, an Indian cybersecurity and blockchain security company, has signed a strategic partnership agreement with LeadPoint, a leading South Korean technology firm specializing in blockchain innovation and product development. The agreement was formalized during GITEX Global 2025, the world’s largest technology summit, held in Dubai.

LeadPoint, renowned for its advancements in blockchain technology, recently launched a government-recognized permissioned blockchain network in South Korea. This innovation has been officially endorsed by South Korean government authorities for its contribution to digital transformation and secure data infrastructure.

Through this partnership, SafeEdges India will collaborate with LeadPoint Korea to enhance the security architecture of permissioned blockchain systems and develop long-term frameworks for cybersecurity resilience. The partnership aims to combine India’s cybersecurity expertise with South Korea’s technological innovation, creating robust and secure digital infrastructure solutions for enterprises and governments.

“This partnership marks a major milestone for both countries in strengthening cybersecurity cooperation,” said Mr. Piyush Shukla, Founder of SafeEdges, who represented the company at the MoU signing ceremony at GITEX Dubai. “Together with LeadPoint, we aim to build secure, scalable, and future-ready blockchain ecosystems that meet the highest global security standards.”

Headquartered in Panna, Madhya Pradesh, India, SafeEdges has emerged as a high-level cybersecurity firm offering advanced services across blockchain security, smart contract audits, and cyber threat intelligence. With a team of skilled security researchers and auditors, the company has worked on securing multi-billion-dollar blockchain ecosystems globally.

This partnership represents a significant step in India–Korea technological cooperation, enabling both companies to leverage their strengths to advance blockchain security, data integrity, and digital infrastructure resilience across international markets.

About SafeEdges

SafeEdges is a leading cybersecurity and blockchain security company based in India. The firm provides comprehensive smart contract auditing, threat modeling, and cyber defense solutions to Web3 startups, enterprises, and government organizations. SafeEdges is known for securing blockchain protocols and ensuring compliance with industry-leading security standards.

Website www.safeedges.in

About LeadPoint

LeadPoint is a South Korea–based technology company specializing in blockchain development, enterprise product solutions, and permissioned blockchain infrastructure. With official recognition from South Korean government agencies, LeadPoint is committed to advancing secure and efficient digital ecosystems across Asia and beyond.

free




Media Contact

Safe Edges info@safeedges.in https://safeedges.in

item.title: CamScanner: Ensuring Data Security and Building Global Trust
item.description:
• Social Media
  • Life
  • Tech & Science
  • World
  • Business
  • Sports
 

CamScanner: Ensuring Data Security and Building Global Trust

PRESS RELEASE
Published October 28, 2025
IndNewsWire

In today's digital world, protecting personal and professional documents has never been more critical. With millions of users around the globe, CamScanner not only provides a fast and convenient scanning experience but also safeguards every document with the highest standards of security and privacy. In an era where cyber threats and privacy concerns dominate headlines, CamScanner has established itself as a trusted and reliable platform.

Adhering to International Security Standards

CamScanner follows globally recognized security standards to ensure the safety and privacy of user data. These include:

  • ISO 27001 - Information Security Management System
  • ISO 27701 - Privacy Information Management System
  • ISO 20000 - IT Service Management

By meeting these rigorous standards, CamScanner ensures that every document is handled with strict operational protocols. Users can be confident that their data is protected from unauthorized access, loss, or misuse--whether they are scanning personal receipts, confidential business contracts, or sensitive academic research.

Advanced Data Storage and Encryption Technologies

Security is built into the very core of CamScanner's platform. Key measures include:

  • Encoded Storage - Scanned documents are never stored in their original format. They are encoded to prevent direct access to raw data.
  • Disk-Level Encryption - All data is encrypted at the disk level, ensuring that even in the unlikely event of a breach, information remains inaccessible.
  • Regular Security Updates - Encryption methods and protocols are constantly updated to tackle evolving cyber threats.

These measures provide users with complete peace of mind. Whether you are storing sensitive financial records, legal documents, or personal files, CamScanner ensures that your information remains secure at every stage.

Dedicated Security and Compliance Team

CamScanner has established a specialized Security and Compliance Committee responsible for overseeing the entire lifecycle of user data. The team's duties include:

  • Conducting regular security audits
  • Updating policies to meet international regulations
  • Training staff to maintain high compliance standards

By actively monitoring every stage of data processing--from scanning to storage, sharing, and deletion--CamScanner ensures that security measures are not only implemented but continuously verified, building global trust.

Trusted by Professionals Worldwide

Millions of users rely on CamScanner for critical work every day. Real-world examples include:

  • Academic researchers scanning sensitive studies and manuscripts
  • Businesses managing confidential contracts and internal reports
  • Government agencies processing secure administrative documents

These scenarios demonstrate that CamScanner's security framework is not just theoretical--it is proven and trusted in demanding environments around the world.

Continuous Improvement and Global Compliance

As digital threats evolve, CamScanner remains proactive. The company regularly updates its security protocols, refines encryption methods, and strengthens internal compliance practices. CamScanner also aligns with international privacy laws, including GDPR, ensuring compliance for users in highly regulated regions such as the United States and Europe. This forward-looking approach demonstrates a long-term commitment to protecting user data.

Looking Ahead

CamScanner continues to innovate, improving both security and user experience. The platform's dedication to safeguarding sensitive information ensures that users can confidently rely on it for everyday document management--whether for work, study, or personal use.

Conclusion

CamScanner is more than a scanning app. It is a secure, reliable, and user-centric platform that prioritizes privacy, transparency, and trust. Through international certifications, advanced encryption, a dedicated compliance team, and ongoing improvements, CamScanner protects user data at every stage. With CamScanner, users can confidently manage their documents, knowing that security and privacy are always a top priority.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

How does CamScanner protect user data?

CamScanner uses multiple security layers, including encrypted storage, disk-level encryption, and regular security updates. All files are encoded before saving to prevent unauthorized access.

Is CamScanner certified for data security?

Yes. CamScanner complies with global standards such as ISO 27001, ISO 27701, and ISO 20000, ensuring top-level data protection and privacy management.

Does CamScanner share data with third parties?

No. CamScanner never shares user data without permission. All operations are monitored by a dedicated Security and Compliance Committee to guarantee transparency and control.

Why Fintech App Development Is Critical for Middle Eastern Enterprises: A Game-Changer for Financial Inclusion

By: GlobePRwire
October 27, 2025 at 13:58 PM EDT

. 

In 2023, mobile payments in the UAE alone will surge to over $1.8 billion, with the market projected to double by the end of 2025. This quick rise certainly backs-up the growing demand for digital-first, innovative financial solutions. Fintech app development is no longer a choice or convenience; it has become a critical requirement for businesses in the Middle East that aim to scale and succeed.  

However, it’s not about building the apps only. For enterprises in the region, fintech apps have become a crucial instrument for attaining financial efficiency, inclusion and customer engagement. With an average half of the population in GCC regions preferring digital financial transactions, the Middle East undoubtedly presents a ripe opportunity for businesses to inculcate digital finance into everyday life. 

Building fintech apps that align with the unique regional needs require a thorough market understanding, strict compliance with the latest data privacy regulations and robust security measures. In this highly regulated industry, partnering with a mobile app development company in Dubai can bring in great expertise in delivering scalable, secure, and future-proof fintech applications. 

The Middle East Fintech Market: Key Trends and Data 

The fintech sector in Middle East is expanding quickly, with Qatar and UAE leading the charge. The fintech industry is expected to cross almost $2 billion by the end of 2025, backed by the growing demand for digital financial services and unwavering government support. Some of the key trends shaping the evolution of fintech app development includes: 

  • Mobile Payments: payment apps and mobile wallets are becoming the go-to solution for consumers in this region, with digital payment volumes witnessing major growth by 30% per annum. 
  • Blockchain and Cryptocurrency: blockchain is gaining major traction in fintech apps for transparent, secure, and efficient transactions. The UAE government has also launched a national blockchain strategy to promote its usage. 
  • Personal Finance Management: fintech applications that offer features such as spending analysis, budgeting, and savings management are gaining massive popularity, given the growing control of consumers over their finances. 
  • Regulatory Advancements: governments in the Middle East region are building regulatory frameworks that offer support to fintech innovation while ensuring the user data and privacy are fully protected. 

 These trends showcase a strong potential in the Middle East region for becoming a global fintech hub, and enterprises that are capitalizing on these developments must act quickly. 

Steps of Enterprise Fintech App Development
