Open Navigation and 3Laws Form Alliance to Redefine Safety and Performance in Robotics Development

October 28, 2025 Jason Quintero

SAN FRANCISCO AND PASADENA, CA – 28/10/2025 – (SeaPRwire) – As robotics rapidly transition from research labs into real-world operations, one challenge has become increasingly clear: autonomy is only as strong as its safety layer. This week, two of the most influential organizations in the robotics ecosystem—Open Navigation LLC, the force behind the open-source Nav2 navigation platform, and 3Laws, the pioneer in dynamic safety guardrail technology—announced a strategic partnership designed to reshape how robots move, perceive, and react in complex environments.

The collaboration marks a significant milestone for the global robotics community. By combining Nav2’s robust, production-grade navigation capabilities with 3Laws’ universal safety layer, developers now have access to a seamless ecosystem that balances innovation with dependability. This integration is further strengthened by the introduction of 3Laws Supervisor ROS, a freely available community tier designed to accelerate the safe development of autonomous systems.

For the more than 300 companies already using Nav2 to power mobile robots across logistics, manufacturing, healthcare, and research, the partnership represents a major leap forward. Nav2 enables advanced path planning, obstacle avoidance, and behavior tree-based control for robots navigating complex and unpredictable spaces. Now, with 3Laws’ adaptive safety technology, these systems gain the ability to dynamically respond to unexpected obstacles in real time, preventing collisions and optimizing motion performance without halting operations through e-stop triggers.

“Open Navigation has alwa

FortifyIQ Secures the Quantum Era with Over-the-Air Updatable Cryptography

Salem, MA, USA — October 27, 2025 — FortifyIQ Inc., a provider of high-assurance hardware and software security solutions and services, announced today the release of FortiPQC, its new post-quantum cryptographic suite designed for certifiable resistance to side-channel and fault-injection attacks (SCA/FIA). The suite comprises soft macro hardware IP cores and software libraries to match any deployment situation. They implement NIST PQC standards (ML-KEM/FIPS203 and ML-DSA/FIPS204) and support a wide range of applications, from cloud to edge to chiplet-based architectures. Both are OTA (over-the-air) updatable, making them adaptable to emerging standards. 

The imminent arrival of mature quantum computing, projected within the next decade, threatens to break the asymmetric cryptography (such as RSA and ECC) that currently secures our most critical systems in banking, defense, and energy. In response, new, quantum-resistant algorithms ML-KEM and ML-DSA were standardized by NIST in August 2024. However, these solutions are computationally intensive and vulnerable to well-known attacks like Side-Channel Analysis (SCA) and Fault Injection Attacks (FIA). FortifyIQ’s patented hardware and software implementations provide an efficient remedy, delivering the robust performance and enhanced security required for the post-quantum era.

 

FortiPQC extends FortifyIQ’s portfolio of algorithmically hardened cryptography, which includes both software libraries and hardware IPs for AES, HMAC-SHA2, and PKA, and even complete Roots-of-Trust (RoT), with a unified API interface. All FortifyIQ solutions are engineered to meet the most rigorous certification targets, such as FIPS 140-3 Level 4, Common Criteria AVA_VAN.5, and SESIP Level 5, with configurability to device and industry requirements for the optimal balance of protection, performance, area, and power efficiency.

High-Assurance Cryptography, Field-Deployable by Design

 FortifyIQ’s hardened software libraries provide certifiable SCA/FIA protection with practical performance levels:

  • FortiAES achieves up to 900 Mbps on a 3.4 GHz CPU and 100 Mbps on a 1.2 GHz ARM core. 
  • FortiHMAC-SHA2 and FortiPKA deliver physical-attack hardened authentication and  public-key cryptography for secure boot, digital signatures, and key exchange.
  • Like the other libraries, FortiPQC maintains baseline performance, latency, and power efficiency while adding robust, certifiable protection, while its overhead is a minimal code-size increase under 10% versus naive software PQC implementations. 
  • All libraries require minimal memory and can be deployed over-the-air (OTA) to retrofit certifiable protection into legacy or cost-constra

item.description:
• How it Works
  • About Us
  • Editorial
  • Writing
  • Pricing
  • Login
  • Sign Up

Pdf whatsapp


Feyree Launches Complete EV Charging Ecosystem: Portable Solutions and Comprehensive Product Collections

Hong Kong, Hong Kong S.A.R. Nov 2, 2025 (Issuewire.com)  - Empowering Electric Vehicle Owners with Smart, Accessible Charging Technology

In an era where electric vehicles are reshaping how we think about mobility, one critical question remains on every EV owner's mind: "How do I ensure reliable charging, whenever and wherever I need it?" Feyree answers that question with a comprehensive ecosystem of intelligent charging solutions designed to adapt to modern lifestyles—today announcing an expanded showcase of its complete product portfolio and specialized portable charger collection.

Meeting Drivers Where They Are 

Electric vehicle adoption has accelerated globally, yet a significant gap persists between charging infrastructure availability and real-world driver needs. Feyree recognizes that charging isn't a one-size-fits-all proposition. Some drivers need robust home installations; others require portable solutions for road trips or backup charging. The newly highlighted all-products collection (https://www.feyree.com/collections/all-products) and dedicated portable charger collection (https://www.feyree.com/collections/portable-charger) reflect Feyree's commitment to empowering EV owners with choice, flexibility, and peace of mind.

A Portfolio Built on Real-World Insights

Feyree's product range spans multiple power levels—from 3.5kW compact chargers to high-capacity 22kW systems—supporting diverse plug standards including Type 2, GB/T, Type 1, and TS-NACS. This breadth signals something important: Feyree isn't chasing trends; it's solving actual problems faced by drivers across different regions, vehicle models, and usage patterns.

The portable charger collection demonstrates particular ingenuity. These units range from lightweight 16A, 3.5kW entry models with built-in 5-meter cables to advanced 32A, 22kW three-phase systems featuring Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and app control. Whether someone needs a reliable backup charger for unexpected situations or a versatile solution for frequent travel, Feyree's portable lineup removes barriers and builds confidence.

Intelligence and Control at Your Fingertips

What truly sets Feyree apart is the integration of smart technology into every tier of its offering. Most chargers now feature Wi-Fi and app connectivity, allowing users to monitor charging sessions, adjust current settings, schedule charging around peak energy hours, and receive status updates remotely. The 4.3-inch display screens on select models provide intuitive, at-a-glance information without requiring smartphone dependency—a thoughtful nod to accessibility and user experience.

Smart timing functionality lets households optimize charging during off-peak electricity rates, reducing costs while supporting grid stability. Dynamic load balancing on wallbox models allows seamless integration into home electrical systems, protecting against overload while maximizing efficiency. These aren't flashy features—they're practical intelligence designed to reduce friction in everyday charging routines.

Standardization Across Regions, Customization for Individual Needs

A persistent challenge in global EV adoption is standardization. Different countries favor different plug types, and vehicles from different manufacturers require different connectors. Feyree's comprehensive portfolio—spanning Type 2 (dominant in Europe), GB/T (standard in China), Type 1 (North American standard), and TS-NACS (emerging standard)—ensures that customers can find solutions tailored to their vehicle and region without compromise.

Adjustable current settings on many models mean a single charger can adapt as vehicle charging capabilities evolve or as household electrical capacity changes. This flexibility extends the useful life of the investment, reducing waste and supporting more sustainable consumption patterns.

Safety as a Foundation, Not an Afterthought

Every Feyree charger incorporates comprehensive protection mechanisms: overload protection, temperature monitoring, ground fault detection, and failsafe disconnection protocols. Rigorous testing against international standards (CE, RoHS, and regional certifications) ensures that reliability isn't assumed—it's verified. For drivers and families using these chargers daily, that assurance matters deeply.

From Driveway to Campground: Portability Reimagined

The portable charger collection particularly embodies Feyree's human-centered philosophy. These units weigh significantly less than fixed installations, feature thoughtfully-designed carrying solutions, and integrate long charging cables (typically 5 meters) that provide genuine flexibility. A family planning a cross-country road trip can stash a portable charger in the trunk, confident that unexpected charging gaps won't derail their plans. An urban apartment dweller without dedicated charging parking can use a portable unit to charge at a friend's home or public outlet.

The Collections: A Resource for Informed Decisions

Browsing Feyree's all-products collection (https://www.feyree.com/collections/all-products) offers comprehensive visibility into the entire ecosystem. Customers can compare power outputs, connectivity features, plug types, and use cases within a single resource. The portable-dedicated collection (

item.title: Digital Lending Platform Trends and Forecast Report 2025: A
item.description:

Digital Lending Platform Trends and Forecast Report 2025: A $39.8 Billion Market by 2033, Driven by Demand for Hassle-Free Loans, Pro-Inclusion Credit Access, and Supportive Regulatory Frameworks

The digital lending platform market presents significant growth opportunities driven by advanced fintech adoption, user preference for streamlined loan processes, and regulatory support. Key trends include enhanced user experience, AI and ML adoption for credit assessment, and expansion into underserved markets, with North America and the US leading the market.

November 03, 2025 06:56 ET  | Source: Research and Markets Research and Markets

Dublin, Nov. 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The "Digital Lending Platform Market Size, Share, Trends and Forecast by Type, Component, Deployment Model, Industry Vertical, and Region, 2025-2033" report has been added to ResearchAndMarkets.com's offering.

The global digital lending platform market size was valued at USD 13.0 Billion in 2024. Looking forward, the publisher estimates the market to reach USD 39.8 Billion by 2033, exhibiting a CAGR of 11.85% from 2025-2033. North America currently dominates the market, holding a market share of over 31.2% in 2024. The growth of North American region is driven by advanced fintech adoption, robust regulatory frameworks, and widespread digital banking.

The global digital lending platform market share is expanding significantly due to the growing user preferences for hassle-free loan processes, which offer streamlined application procedures, real-time approval mechanisms, and personalized loan products designed to meet diverse financial needs. Moreover, the rising introduction of favorable regulations and policies by governments and financial authorities is encouraging innovation within the digital lending ecosystem while ensuring user protection and maintaining the stability of financial systems. Apart from this, digital lending platforms are playing a critical role in promoting financial inclusion by extending credit services to underserved populations that are often excluded

item.title: From Tools to Transformation: Darren Coleman on Why Every Business Needs an AI Strategy
item.description:
• Social Media
  • Life
  • Tech & Science
  • World
  • Business
  • Sports
 

From Tools to Transformation: Darren Coleman on Why Every Business Needs an AI Strategy

PRESS RELEASE
Published November 3, 2025
Vehement Media

 

At the Boca Raton Innovation Campus—the historic birthplace of IBM’s personal computer and a landmark of tech innovation—leaders from around the world gathered for the 7 Figure MSP Global Conference, a three-day exploration into how artificial intelligence is reshaping the future of business.

Among them was Darren Coleman, CEO of Coleman Technologies, a Langley-based IT and cybersecurity firm. Known for his pragmatic view of technology, Coleman brought a disciplined perspective to a conversation often dominated by hype. His message was clear:

“The companies that will win with AI aren’t the ones chasing the latest tools—they’re the ones building the smartest strategies.”

Beyond the Hype: Turning AI into a Managed Service

Coleman’s keynote introduced what he calls Strategic AI Management—a structured approach that treats AI not as an experiment, but as a managed service aligned with leadership intent. His Tiered AI Services Framework moves organizations through three deliberate phases:

  • Foundation: Awareness, policy, and training.
  • Rollout: Departmental enablement and prompt design.
  • Optimization: ROI measurement, governance, and continuous improvement.

Early adopters say the framework provides clarity in a space often defined by experimentation. “It’s about leadership, not luck,” Coleman explained. “AI can absolutely transform productivity, but without direction, it becomes another unmanaged risk. Leaders have to own it.”

Balancing Productivity and Protection

Coleman’s background in cybersecurity gives him a unique vantage point. He’s seen how the same technology driving efficiency can also expand exposure.

“AI is the most powerful productivity engine we’ve ever had,” he said. “But it’s also the newest attack surface. The real differentiator isn’t who uses AI—it’s who governs it.”

He pointed to the growing trend of employees independently adopting AI tools without oversight, creating what experts call “shadow IT.” Coleman urged leaders to address the issue through structure, not restriction—making AI adoption both safer and more effective.

A Shared Stage, Different Lens

Sharing the stage was Mitch Joel, the renowned author and digital transformation strategist. Joel’s workshop encouraged attendees to reimagine creativity and customer engagement through AI. Coleman’s perspective complemented that vision—grounding innovation in governance, security, and measurable ROI.

Together, their sessions reflected two sides of the same coin: Joel emphasizing the creative horizon of AI, and Coleman anchoring it in operational discipline.

Educating the Next Generation of AI Leaders

Beyond the conference, Coleman is extending his mission to educate business leaders through his upcoming AI 101 for Business webinar series. The program offers five actionable steps for secure adoption—leadership alignment, clear policy, training, collaboration, and incentives—helping small and midsized businesses embrace AI with confidence.

“Our role as technology partners is changing,” Coleman said. “We’re moving from fixing problems to guiding innovation. Every business deserves a framework that balances productivity and protection.”

The Leadership Imperative

As AI accelerates into every layer of business, Coleman believes a new kind of leadership is emerging—defined not by technical mastery, but by strategic clarity.

“AI doesn’t replace leadership,” he concluded. “It requires it. The future belongs to the businesses that think before they automate.”

About Darren Coleman:

Darren Coleman is the CEO of Coleman Technologies, a Langley, BC–based managed IT and cybersecurity firm recognized for 25 years of innovation in cloud, AI, and data protection. Under his leadership, the company has been named MSP of the Year at The 20’s VISION 25 Conference and is a three-time Consumer Choice Award winner. Coleman is also a #1 bestselling co-author of Easy Prey and The Canadian IT Playbook, and a frequent media contributor on the evolving intersection of technology, risk, and leadership.

Vehement Media

    More from Vehement Media

Fnezx Asset Security and Multi-Layer Risk Control System Announcement

By: Binary News Network
November 03, 2025 at 04:02 AM EST

Fnezx has recently released multi-layer risk control and custody rules, covering key management, account security, network defenses, and on-chain intelligence. Asset security remains the highest priority of Fnezx. The platform utilizes cold-hot wallet separation, MPC (multi-party computation) signatures, and hardware security modules. Key shards are stored at multiple locations, ensuring that single-point failures do not compromise overall security. On the account side, device binding and secondary verification are enabled. Withdrawals, sensitive information changes, and batch operations require multi-level authorization and delayed activation to reduce risks of theft and social engineering.

The on-chain intelligence system monitors address labels, counterparties, and fund concentration. Risk control models dynamically set limits based on user profiles and behavioral history, with dedicated strategies for short-term high-frequency actions and cross-asset transfers. At the network layer, the platform conducts DDoS defense drills and fault injection tests; critical nodes are equipped with elastic scaling and local routing to maintain stable availability under high-stress scenarios.

Security incident handling procedures are open and transparent, including rapid reporting channels, evidence collection guidelines, and remediation paths. During major holidays and periods of market volatility, Fnezx implements enhanced monitoring, with logs and forensic standards available for third-party review. User education materials cover password management, authorization recognition, phishing prevention, and wallet migration to reduce avoidable risk exposure. The platform will continually disclose security metrics, track improvement results, and report externally.

The system calculates risk scores for login attempts from different sources, triggering SMS, email, or authenticator verification to mitigate risks associated with credential stuffing and data breaches. Permission management follows the principle of least privilege; operational activities are routed through audit channels, and critical commands require dual authorization. Fnezx collaborates with the security community, accepts vulnerability submissions with rewards, and publicly reports remediation progress and impact assessments.

For users, one-click freezing, emergency contacts, and transaction notification controls are provided to minimize potential losses. The long-term goal is to embed security costs into product design and default settings, using clear interfaces and prompts to guide users toward safe choices. Fnezx will periodically publish key metrics and rectification progress, ensuring alignment between external expectations and internal execution.

Company: Fnezx Digital Assets Inc

Contact Person:Jonas Müller

Email: support@fnezx.org

Website:https://www.fnezx.org

CPT of South Florida Is Offers Cyber Security Consulting Services to Manage AI Cybersecurity Risks

By: ReleaseWire
November 02, 2025 at 20:47 PM EST

This press release was orginally distributed by ReleaseWire

Ft. Lauderdale, FL -- (ReleaseWire) -- 11/02/2025 -- CPT of South Florida is a leading cyber security consulting service for Boca Raton, Miami, Fort Lauderdale, West Palm Beach, Doral, Miramar, and the surrounding areas. While AI has offered many benefits for businesses, AI has also introduced a new wave of cyber threats that are more complex, faster, and harder to detect than ever before.

The Dangers of AI

AI-based tools are now commonly used to help manage sensitive business data, automate communication, and even detect security threats in real-time. However, this also means that hackers and malicious actors are increasingly using AI to find and exploit vulnerabilities in business systems.

These AI-driven cyberattacks can bypass traditional security measures with frightening speed and precision, making businesses more vulnerable than ever before. From AI-powered phishing attacks to deepfakes and automated data breaches, the risks are growing.

Managing Risks with Cyber Security Consulting Services

A trusted cybersecurity consulting service steps in to provide essential protection. Companies in South Florida need experienced professionals to navigate the complexities of AI risks and safeguard their critical data.

A cybersecurity consulting service, like CPT of South Florida, can offer tailored strategies to mitigate these risks, implement robust defenses, and ensure that AI-powered tools are used safely without compromising security. With the right support, businesses can benefit from AI's advancements while minimizing the dangers it brings.

About CPT of South Florida
CPT of South Florida proudly offers customized cyber security consulting services to Boca Raton, Miami, Fort Lauderdale, West Palm Beach, Doral, Miramar, and the surrounding areas. Understanding the dangers of AI and how to mitigate threats, CPT of South Florida provides tailored strategies to help businesses stay secure in an increasingly AI-driven world.

With decades of experience and a deep understanding of the evolving threat landscape, CPT of South Florida stands as a trusted partner for businesses seeking clarity and control. Visit www.cpt-florida.com or call 954-963-2775 to learn more about cyber security consulting services!

For more information on this press release visit: http://www.releasewire.com/press-releases/cpt-of-south-florida-is-offers-cyber-security-consulting-services-to-manage-ai-cybersecurity-risks-1385985.htm

Media Relations Contact

Press Manager

Web: https://www.cpt-florida.com/

Wireless Network Security Market by Type and Application: Rapid Growth Projected from USD 5.1 billion (2026) to USD 13.2 billion (2033)

11-03-2025 03:54 AM CET | IT, New Media & Software

Press release from: Market Research Intellect

Wireless Network Security Market

New Jersey, US State: "The global Wireless Network Security market in the Information Technology and Telecom category is projected to reach USD 13.2 billion by 2031, growing at a CAGR of 11.5% from 2025 to 2031. With rising industrial adoption and continuous innovation in Information Technology and Telecom applications, the market is estimated to hit USD 5.1 billion in 2024, highlighting strong growth potential throughout the forecast period."

Wireless Network Security Market Size & Forecast 2031
The Wireless Network Security Market is witnessing robust growth driven by escalating cyber threats, rapid digitalization, and the proliferation of IoT devices across industries. Enterprises are increasingly investing in advanced network protection frameworks to secure Wi-Fi networks and mitigate data breaches. The rising adoption of cloud-based security solutions, coupled with the growing demand for secure remote access, is further enhancing market expansion. Additionally, the surge in BYOD policies and increased reliance on wireless communication technologies are prompting organizations to deploy sophisticated encryption, intrusion detection, and threat management systems to ensure uninterrupted and secure connectivity.

Market growth is further fueled by advancements in AI-driven cybersecurity tools and next-generation firewalls that offer real-time analytics and automated threat response. The integration of machine learning and blockchain technologies in wireless network protection is creating new opportunities for innovation and resilience. With stringent regulatory mandates emphasizing data privacy and compliance, industries such as healthcare, banking, and manufacturing are prioritizing end-to-end wireless security frameworks. By 2031, the Wireless Network Security Market is expected to achieve substantial valuation, supported by continuous technological evolution, increasing cyberattack sophistication, and the need for fortified wireless communication infrastructures worldwide.

Key Players in the Wireless Network Security Market

Cisco Systems Inc.
Palo Alto Networks Inc.
Fortinet Inc.
Check Point Software Technologies Ltd.
McAfee LLC
Trend Micro Incorporated
Sophos Ltd.
Barracuda Networks Inc.
Juniper Networks Inc.
Arista Networks Inc.
IBM Corporation

Press release

Emerging Trends in Physical Security Software Market by Type and Application to Drive Valuation from USD 5.67 billion to USD 10.89 billion by 2033

11-02-2025 03:48 PM CET | Advertising, Media Consulting, Marketing Research

Press release from: Market Research Intellect

Emerging Trends in Physical Security Software Market

New Jersey, US State: "The global Physical Security Software market in the Information Technology and Telecom category is projected to reach USD 10.89 billion by 2031, growing at a CAGR of 8.25% from 2025 to 2031. With rising industrial adoption and continuous innovation in Information Technology and Telecom applications, the market is estimated to hit USD 5.67 billion in 2024, highlighting strong growth potential throughout the forecast period."

Physical Security Software Market Size & Forecast 2031
The physical security software market is expected to witness robust growth through 2031, driven by increasing concerns around facility protection, asset monitoring, and access control. These platforms enable centralized management of surveillance systems, intrusion detection, and visitor tracking, offering real-time situational awareness and incident response. Integration with IoT devices and cloud infrastructure is enhancing scalability and remote accessibility. Enterprises across sectors such as manufacturing, transportation, and education are investing in advanced physical security solutions to safeguard personnel and infrastructure. The market is also benefiting from smart city initiatives and regulatory mandates for public safety.

Vendors are innovating with AI-powered video analytics, biometric authentication, and predictive threat modeling to improve security outcomes. The convergence of physical and cybersecurity is driving demand for unified platforms that offer holistic risk management. Deployment models are shifting toward SaaS and hybrid architectures to support flexible operations. North America is expected to lead due to high security spending and technological adoption, while Asia-Pacific is gaining momentum with infrastructure modernization. Strategic alliances, feature-rich platforms, and compliance readiness will define competitive positioning in the physical security software market through 2031.

Key Players in the Physical Security Software Market
Axis Communications
Honeywell
Bosch Security Systems
Genetec
Milestone Systems
Avigilon
Johnson Controls
Tyco
Gallagher
Verint

The Digital Age of Opportunity: How Smart Technology Is Transforming Modern Business

By: GlobePRwire
November 02, 2025 at 06:40 AM EST

In the 21st century, technology is more than just a tool — it’s the driving force behind global progress. Every day, new innovations are changing the way we live, work, and communicate. From artificial intelligence to blockchain and cloud computing, technology is reshaping industries at an incredible pace. Platforms like 326687.com

are helping individuals and businesses stay informed and prepared for this exciting digital transformation.

1. Technology as a Business Catalyst

Today’s business world runs on digital efficiency. Automation, data analytics, and online communication tools have replaced outdated processes, making businesses faster and smarter.

With the help of modern digital systems, even small startups can compete with global corporations. Tools like CRM software, AI-driven insights, and cloud solutions simplify operations and reduce costs. To explore how technology can empower your business, 326687.com

offers helpful insights and updates on modern innovation and digital adoption.

Businesses that embrace technology don’t just survive — they thrive. They gain better visibility, improved customer relationships, and the agility to adapt quickly to market changes.

2. The Rise of Online Platforms

The internet has given businesses a global stage. E-commerce, digital marketing, and remote collaboration tools have opened doors that were unimaginable two decades ago.

From selling products online to managing remote teams, technology bridges the gap between companies and customers. Platforms like 326687.com

discuss the latest digital trends that shape how modern organizations connect with audiences across borders.

With effective online strategies, even local businesses can reach international markets. Having a strong online presence — through SEO, social media, and digital branding — is no longer optional but essential for growth.

3. Data: The New Digital Currency

In today’s digital economy, data has become one of the most valuable assets. Every online action generates information — and companies that know how to analyze it gain a major competitive advantage.

Through advanced analytics, businesses can understand customer behavior, predict trends, and create personalized experiences. Learning to leverage this data responsibly is key to sustainable growth. For entrepreneurs and marketers seeking guidance on data-driven success, 326687.com

shares knowledge on the evolving role of technology and analytics in business.

4. Adapting to Technological Change

The digital revolution moves quickly — and staying ahead means staying informed. New technologies such as artificial intelligence, blockchain, and automation are redefining industries from finance to healthcare.

Embracing these innovations early gives businesses a strategic edge. Platforms like 326687.com

make it easier for professionals to keep up with tech advancements and find practical ways to integrate them into their workflows.

Continuous learning and adaptation are the keys to success in this ever-evolving environment.

5. Cybersecurity: Protecting the Digital Future

With digital growth comes the challenge of security. As companies store more information online, cyber threats have become a serious concern.

Building a secure digital infrastructure ensures that customer data and business assets remain protected. Modern cybersecurity solutions such as encryption, two-factor authentication, and blockchain verification provide strong defenses. You can find helpful insights on staying safe in the online world through platforms like 326687.com</

Press release

Global Cyber Situational Awareness Csa Market Outlook 2026-2033: Key Type and Application Segments Fuel 12.8% CAGR Growth

11-01-2025 07:25 PM CET | Aerospace & Defense

Press release from: Market Research Intellect

New Jersey, US State: "The global Cyber Situational Awareness Csa market in the Information Technology and Telecom category is projected to reach USD 10.2 billion by 2031, growing at a CAGR of 12.8% from 2025 to 2031. With rising industrial adoption and continuous innovation in Information Technology and Telecom applications, the market is estimated to hit USD 4.5 billion in 2024, highlighting strong growth potential throughout the forecast period."

Cyber Situational Awareness (CSA) Market Size & Forecast 2031
The Cyber Situational Awareness (CSA) market is projected to grow significantly by 2031, driven by the increasing need for real-time monitoring, threat detection, and proactive cybersecurity management across enterprises and government organizations. CSA solutions provide comprehensive visibility into network activities, potential vulnerabilities, and cyber threats, enabling rapid decision-making and effective risk mitigation. The rise of sophisticated cyberattacks, cloud adoption, and IoT integration is accelerating demand for advanced situational awareness tools that combine analytics, artificial intelligence, and automated alert systems. Organizations are increasingly relying on CSA to enhance resilience, protect sensitive data, and maintain operational continuity.

By 2031, the CSA market is expected to expand as businesses focus on strengthening cybersecurity posture, compliance, and incident response capabilities. Vendors are offering scalable, integrated platforms with features such as real-time dashboards, threat intelligence feeds, and predictive analytics to detect and respond to cyber threats efficiently. The growing emphasis on securing critical infrastructure, financial systems, and digital assets is driving adoption across sectors including defense, finance, healthcare, and energy. Continuous advancements in machine learning, automation, and visualization technologies position CSA solutions as essential tools for proactive cyber risk management and strategic decision-making, supporting sustained market growth throughout the forecast period.

Key Players in the Cyber Situational Awareness Csa Market

IBM
Cisco Systems
FireEye
Splunk
McAfee
Palo Alto Networks
Forcepoint
Trend Micro
Check Point Software
CrowdStrike
Darktrace

item.title: Dragon Pharma Unveils Next-Generation Online Storefront to Expand Global Access and Enhance Customer Experience | Technology News Journal
item.description:
Technology News Journal "THINK GLOBALLY, READ LOCALLY"
SEE OTHER BRANDS

Global take on science and technology news

Questions? +1 (202) 335-9303 | Contact
Submit Press Release
Latest News Press Releases
Submit Press Release

Dragon Pharma Unveils Next-Generation Online Storefront to Expand Global Access and Enhance Customer Experience

DUBAI, United Arab Emirates, Nov. 01, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Dragon Pharma, a leading global provider of research-grade pharmaceuticals and performance solutions, has officially announced the launch of its newly enhanced online platform.This milestone represents a significant leap forward in the company’s mission to deliver high-quality, trusted products to professionals and customers worldwide through a faster, safer, and more user-friendly digital experience.

Enterprise Defence Appoints David Maher as Chief Commercial Officer as It Scales Operations at Home and Abroad

Enterprise Defence, the award-winning cybersecurity and IT solutions firm, has appointed David Maher as Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) as the company accelerates its expansion in Ireland and overseas. 

David joins the executive team to lead Enterprise Defence’s commercial strategy and drive growth across its new and expanding suite of AI-driven and risk management software solutions. The appointment comes as the company scales operations and strengthens its presence in international markets. 

With more than 20 years of experience in technology and cybersecurity in senior leadership roles, David Maher is known for his forward-thinking leadership and consistent record in delivering strong commercial performance. He has worked extensively in business transformation, client engagement, and strategic growth across both enterprise and emerging markets. 

“David’s appointment is a key step in the next phase of Enterprise Defence’s growth,” said Ross Palmer, Chief Executive Officer. “His strategic mindset and leadership experience will be vital as we scale the business and continue to deliver trusted, world-class cybersecurity and AI solutions to our clients.” 

New Chief Commercial Officer David Maher said the company is well positioned to build on its momentum: 

“Enterprise Defence has a clear vision and a strong reputation for excellence. Our focus now is on scaling the business through innovative software solutions that help clients manage risk and stay secure in a fast-changing digital world.” 

The appointment strengthens Enterprise Defence’s leadership team at a time when demand for advanced cybersecurity and AI-driven risk solutions continues to rise across global markets.

item.title: Enhancing Financial Regulatory Compliance and Risk Management: FinanceHub Solutions Launches Initiative for an Integrated Risk Management Platform (IRMP)
item.description:
• Social Media
  • Life
  • Tech & Science
  • World
  • Business
  • Sports
 

Enhancing Financial Regulatory Compliance and Risk Management: FinanceHub Solutions Launches Initiative for an Integrated Risk Management Platform (IRMP)

PRESS RELEASE
Published November 1, 2025
IndNewsWire

Minneapolis, MN - FinanceHub Solutions, a consultancy founded by Bilal Shahid, an international risk management expert, announced its initiative to develop an Integrated Risk Management Platform (IRMP) tailored for U.S. government agencies. The project aims to directly support federal, state, and municipal priorities to strengthen financial oversight, mitigate systemic risks, and advance cybersecurity resilience.

Addressing a Growing National Challenge

Government operations across the United States face a complex and interdependent risk environment. The U.S. Government Accountability Office (GAO) has repeatedly designated financial management, IT modernization, and cybersecurity among its "high risk" areas, noting vulnerabilities that threaten efficiency, transparency, and public trust. Meanwhile, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) estimates that over 500,000 cybersecurity positions remain unfilled, limiting the nation's capacity to safeguard critical infrastructure and sensitive data.

Multiple federal strategies have highlighted the urgency of enhancing governance and compliance:

  • The 2023 National Cybersecurity Strategy emphasizes integrated, whole-of-nation approaches to cyber resilience.
  • The Financial Stability Oversight Council (FSOC) calls for expanded systemic risk monitoring to prevent crises in financial markets.
  • The Office of Management and Budget (OMB) Federal Zero Trust Strategy mandates agencies to strengthen IT controls and data protection.

Despite these efforts, public sector organizations remain fragmented in their approach to risk management, often operating with siloed systems and outdated controls.

The FinanceHub Solutions Initiative

The Integrated Risk Management Platform (IRMP), spearheaded by FinanceHub Solutions, responds to this national imperative. By integrating financial compliance, enterprise risk management, data analytics, and cybersecurity assurance into a single platform, the IRMP aims to transform how government agencies identify, assess, and mitigate risks.

The platform is designed to:

  • Consolidate risk management functions - streamlining internal audits, compliance checks, IT risk reviews, and fraud detection into a unified system.
  • Enhance financial integrity - ensuring taxpayer dollars are safeguarded through automated monitoring and robust internal controls.
  • Support cybersecurity resilience by embedding the NIST Cybersecurity Framework and CISA directives to fortify agency IT systems against evolving threats.
  • Leverage advanced analytics enabling predictive modeling of risks and data-driven decision-making.
  • Promote transparency and accountability aligning with U.S. government priorities to rebuild public trust in institutions.

Relevance to U.S. Policy Goals

The FinanceHub Solutions IRMP aligns directly with federal directives:

  • CISA Best Practices underscore the need for proactive frameworks to secure critical infrastructure.
  • FSOC Annual Reports warn of systemic vulnerabilities that require integrated oversight.
  • Federal Data Strategy promotes data as a strategic asset, a principle central to IRMP's predictive analytics.

By consolidating risk governance, FinanceHub's approach offers scalable and replicable benefits to federal, state, and local government agencies.

The Expertise Behind the Endeavor

Bilal Shahid, a seasoned governance, risk, and compliance professional with over 20 years of international experience, is leading this initiative. His credentials include CPA, FCMA, CIA, CISA, CFE, GCRP, GRCA, and IAAP, underscoring his expertise in both financial and IT risk domains.

Mr. Shahid has:

  • Directed audits and compliance reviews for projects exceeding $20 billion in the petrochemical sector.
  • Implemented enterprise risk management frameworks aligned with ISO 31000 and NIST 800-53.
  • Designed and led anti-money laundering (AML) programs in banking.
  • Published research on the Three Lines Model of Risk Management in the Management Accountant Journal and Enhancing Financial Regulatory Compliance and Risk Management Framework by the Development of an Integrated Risk Management Platform IRMP in the peer-reviewed journal International Research Journal of Education and Technology (IRJedT)

  • Trained and mentored next-generation auditors, extending his impact beyond organizational boundaries.

Through FinanceHub Solutions, Mr. Shahid brings this experience to the U.S. context, focusing on collaboration, consultancy for startups, and government-facing innovation.

Expected Impact

The IRMP is projected to deliver measurable outcomes for U.S. agencies:

  • Fraud prevention and recovery - reducing vulnerabilities in financial reporting and compliance gaps.
  • Cyber resilience - enhancing readiness against ransomware, identity theft, and data breaches.
  • Operational efficiency - lowering duplication of risk functions and reducing compliance costs.
  • Public trust - increasing transparency through integrated, auditable processes.

If implemented at scale, the IRMP could generate multi-million-dollar savings annually in recovered revenues and fraud prevention, while significantly enhancing the integrity of public administration.

Policy and Regulatory Significance

By situating its solution within the framework of critical and emerging technologies identified by the U.S. government, particularly cybersecurity and advanced analytics, FinanceHub Solutions emphasizes its contribution to long-term national priorities. The initiative reflects recognition that risk management is not solely a corporate function, but a matter of public interest and national security.

About FinanceHub Solutions

FinanceHub Solutions is a Minnesota consultancy dedicated to advancing risk management, governance, and compliance innovation. The firm's mission is to design and deploy integrated solutions that safeguard financial integrity, enhance transparency, and strengthen public trust in institutions.

About Bilal Shahid

Bilal Shahid is a global risk management professional with more than two decades of experience across the United States, Saudi Arabia, Pakistan, and Bermuda. His expertise spans internal audit, enterprise risk management, IT and cybersecurity assurance, anti-fraud frameworks, and financial compliance. As the founder of FinanceHub Solutions, he is leading the development of the Integrated Risk Management Platform, designed to enhance U.S. government resilience and efficiency in the face of evolving threats

"The challenges facing U.S. government agencies from financial fraud to cyber threats require integrated solutions that bridge compliance, governance, and technology. The Integrated Risk Management Platform is designed to serve as that

Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) Tools Market by Type and Application: Rapid Growth Projected from USD 5.5 billion (2026) to USD 12.8 billion (2033)

11-01-2025 12:16 PM CET | IT, New Media & Software

Press release from: Market Research Intellect

New Jersey, US State: "The global Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) Tools market in the Information Technology and Telecom category is projected to reach USD 12.8 billion by 2031, growing at a CAGR of 10.3% from 2025 to 2031. With rising industrial adoption and continuous innovation in Information Technology and Telecom applications, the market is estimated to hit USD 5.5 billion in 2024, highlighting strong growth potential throughout the forecast period."

The Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) Tools market is poised for substantial growth by 2031, fueled by the rising need for actionable intelligence in cybersecurity, law enforcement, and corporate investigations. OSINT tools enable organizations to collect, analyze, and interpret publicly available data from diverse digital sources, enhancing decision-making and risk assessment processes. Increasing cyber threats, regulatory compliance requirements, and the growing adoption of digital platforms for business operations are key drivers propelling the market, as entities seek efficient ways to monitor, analyze, and respond to potential risks.

Advancements in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and data analytics are significantly enhancing OSINT tool capabilities, offering real-time monitoring, automated data collection, and comprehensive threat intelligence. Organizations across government, defense, and commercial sectors are investing in sophisticated OSINT solutions to improve situational awareness, detect fraudulent activities, and strengthen security frameworks. By 2031, the market is expected to witness widespread adoption globally, driven by the need for accurate, timely, and actionable intelligence from open sources to support critical operational and strategic decisions.

Startups Gain Financial Clarity with ACRU Solutions’ Outsourced Accounting Services

By: Press Release Distribution Service
October 31, 2025 at 23:20 PM EDT

ACRU Solutions, a leader in outsourced accounting for startups, is transforming how emerging companies manage their finances. Designed specifically for early-stage and scaling businesses, ACRU’s model provides the structure, accuracy, and financial visibility of a full accounting department.

Denver, Colorado, United States, November 1, 2025 -- ACRU Solutions, a leader in outsourced accounting for startups, is transforming how emerging companies manage their finances. Designed specifically for early-stage and scaling businesses, ACRU’s model provides the structure, accuracy, and financial visibility of a full accounting department without the cost or overhead of building one in-house. By combining expert oversight with advanced automation, ACRU Solutions helps startups achieve real financial clarity, enabling founders to make faster, smarter decisions from day one.

Early-stage and scaling startups often struggle to balance growth with financial accuracy. As teams expand and transaction volumes increase, bookkeeping errors, inconsistent reporting, and compliance gaps can quietly erode profitability and investor confidence. ACRU Solutions addresses these challenges by delivering a system built for transparency, accuracy, and adaptability, transforming financial management from a reactive function into a proactive asset for growth.

At the center of ACRU’s outsourced accounting model is an approach that integrates advanced automation with expert oversight. Every client engagement begins with a detailed assessment of existing systems and workflows, ensuring accounting processes are streamlined from the start. Once onboarding is complete, ACRU’s team manages transaction recording, reconciliations, payables, receivables, and reporting through secure, cloud-based platforms that sync with banking, payroll, and payment systems in real time. The result is a consistent flow of accurate financial data that drives better decisions at every stage of business development.

The service model is designed with flexibility in mind. Whether managing early operations or preparing for venture funding, ACRU adapts to each stage of the startup lifecycle. Financial reports are delivered on a recurring schedule, offering founders a clear picture of profitability, cash runway, and budget performance. Monthly closes and custom dashboards ensure decision-makers have instant access to metrics that matter, helping teams spot opportunities, manage burn rate, and forecast future needs without guesswork.

One of ACRU’s distinguishing strengths lies in its focus on compliance and readiness. As startups face increasingly complex requirements, from new 1099 reporting rules to multi-state tax obligations, maintaining compliance has become critical. ACRU’s systems and staff manage these processes behind the scenes, ensuring tax filings, entity structures, and regulatory documentation remain accurate and audit-ready throughout the year. This proactive approach reduces risk, shortens close cycles, and eliminates the last-minute rush that often comes with traditional year-end accounting.

To support the demands of modern businesses, ACRU Solutions’ platform is compatible with all major accounting software, including QuickBooks, NetSuite, and Digits. The firm’s specialists work seamlessly within each environment, optimizing setup and processes while maintaining data integrity. This flexibility allows startups to continue using familiar tools while gaining the benefit of dedicated financial expertise, from routine bookkeeping to strategic analysis.

Security and data protection are built into every process. ACRU employs bank-level encryption, multi-factor authentication, and secure document management to safeguard sensitive financial data. Each transaction is tracked through audit trails, and automated alerts flag irregularities for immediate review. This layered control structure minimizes risk while maintaining full transparency for founders and

WEI Reaches New Cybersecurity Milestone as Palo Alto Networks Names It a NextWave Diamond Innovator

November 1, 2025 Jason Quintero

SALEM, NH – 01/11/2025 – (SeaPRwire) – In a major endorsement of its technical expertise and commitment to cybersecurity innovation, WEI, a leading full-service IT solutions provider, has been officially recognized as a Palo Alto Networks NextWave Diamond Innovator. This designation places WEI among a select global group of partners who have demonstrated the highest levels of technical proficiency, customer success, and strategic alignment within the NextWave Partner Program, an ecosystem that helps organizations worldwide achieve superior security outcomes.

The announcement marks not only a recognition of WEI’s 36-year history of innovation but also a clear acknowledgment of its deep cybersecurity capabilities across complex digital infrastructures. With over 100 certified engineers, decades of proven project delivery, and a state-of-the-art integration and testing lab, WEI has built a formidable reputation for enabling organizations across industries—healthcare, finance, higher education, manufacturing, and retail—to strengthen their security posture in a rapidly evolving threat landscape.

A Trusted Partner for Modern Security Transformation

WEI’s recognition as a Diamond Innovator underscores its exceptional expertise in deploying and managing Palo Alto Networks’ full portfolio of advanced security technologies, including Next-Generation Firewalls, Prisma SASE, and the Cortex suite (XDR, XSOAR, and XSIAM). These capabilities empower WEI to help enterprises modernize their network and cloud defenses while integrating intelligence-driven protection across endpoints and hybrid environments

GoodData Unveils Next-Generation AI Platform to Power the Future of Financial Data Intelligence

November 1, 2025 Jason Quintero

SAN FRANCISCO, CA – 01/11/2025 – (SeaPRwire) – The financial industry stands on the brink of a major technological transformation — one where traditional dashboards and static analytics are giving way to autonomous, AI-powered intelligence. At the forefront of this shift is GoodData, a leading analytics and data intelligence company, which today announced the launch of new finance-focused applications for its Composable AI Platform. The initiative aims to help financial institutions navigate an increasingly complex landscape marked by strict regulations, siloed data, and growing pressure for real-time insights and compliance automation.

GoodData’s expanded platform unifies three critical layers — AI Lake, AI Hub, and AI Apps — into one composable foundation for enterprise AI and data intelligence. This powerful integration enables banks, insurers, and asset managers to create and deploy their own AI agents capable of automating fraud detection, enhancing regulatory reporting, improving client interactions, and ensuring transparency across every transaction.

Addressing the Unique Challenges of Financial Institutions

The finance sector faces challenges that few other industries experience: constant regulatory changes, the need for impeccable data governance, and the coexistence of legacy infrastructure with modern cloud technologies. GoodData’s platform was engineered precisely for this complexity.

  • AI Lake transforms structured and unstructured data — such as transactions, loan records, and compliance documents — into a governed semantic layer. This ensures AI mod

Securmans Redefines Security & Blue-Collar Services in India with Affordable, Tech-Based Solutions

  • SecurmansImg

Bengaluru, Karnataka Oct 31, 2025 (Issuewire.com)  - Securmans Security & Manpower Services Pvt. Ltd. — a leading manpower and security services company based in Bangalore — is transforming the way organizations and communities hire security guards, housekeeping staff, valet attendants, drivers, and other blue-collar professionals.

By combining affordability with uncompromised quality, Securmans is rapidly becoming a trusted partner across Tier 1 and Tier 2 cities, giving tough competition to traditional service providers in the market.

Services Offered

Securmans provides a complete range of professional manpower solutions:

  • Security Guards for residential, corporate, industrial, and event-based needs.

  • Housekeeping Services ensuring hygiene, cleanliness, and maintenance.

  • Valet Parking & Driver Services for commercial establishments and premium events.

  • Specialized Personnel like bouncers, gunmen, and personal guards for high-security requirements.

Each category is backed by rigorous screening, training, and supervision standards that ensure reliability and professionalism.

USP: Affordability Meets Quality

Securmans’ unique proposition lies in delivering top-tier manpower services at affordable pricing and problem solving — bridging the gap between cost efficiency and premium quality.

“Our mission is simple — to make reliable and professional manpower accessible to every business and household without inflating costs,” said Aminul H, Chairman & Founder, Securmans.

Read more about Securmans’ values and approach at www.securmans.in.

Upcoming IOS & Android App: The First Tech-Based Platform in India

Securmans is gearing up to launch its dedicated IOS and Android app, which will address long-standing issues in the security and blue-collar manpower industry.

The app will feature:

  • Real-time workforce tracking and deployment dashboards

  • Transparent pricing, billing, and service feedback

  • In-app communication and escalation channels

This ecosystem will make Securmans the first tech-based security and blue-collar service provider in India, revolutionizing the manpower sector with transparency, traceability, and technology integration.

Learn more about the upcoming digital platform at Securmans Official Website.

Expansion Across India

After establishing a strong foothold in Bangalore, Securmans is expanding to Mumbai, Delhi NCR, Hyderabad, Pune, Coimbatore, Mysore, and other Tier 2 cities, with a vision to become a nationwide brand offering reliable workforce solutions at scale.

Securmans’ rapid growth and

Press release

Testing As A Service Taas Market Size by Type & Application Expected to Surge from USD 5.2 billion in 2026 to USD 12.1 billion by 2033

11-01-2025 01:34 AM CET | Advertising, Media Consulting, Marketing Research

Press release from: Market Research Intellect

Testing As A Service Taas Market

New Jersey, US State: "The global Testing As A Service Taas market in the Information Technology and Telecom category is projected to reach USD 12.1 billion by 2031, growing at a CAGR of 10.3% from 2025 to 2031. With rising industrial adoption and continuous innovation in Information Technology and Telecom applications, the market is estimated to hit USD 5.2 billion in 2024, highlighting strong growth potential throughout the forecast period."

Testing As A Service TaaS market size and forecast 2031
By 2031, Testing as a Service is expected to be shaped by accelerating cloud adoption, heightened cybersecurity requirements, and the maturation of AI-driven automation across software delivery lifecycles. Enterprises will prioritize outcome-based, scalable testing models that integrate seamlessly with CI/CD pipelines, enabling earlier defect detection and faster release cadences. Demand will expand in regulated industries seeking continuous compliance validation, while microservices, APIs, and edge applications push growth in performance, reliability, and interoperability testing. Generative AI will uplift test design, data synthesis, and self-healing automation, reducing maintenance overhead and expanding coverage of complex user journeys. As organizations modernize legacy stacks and migrate to hybrid environments, platform-agnostic TaaS offerings providing unified observability, risk scoring, and traceability will become strategic. Pricing will favor consumption flexibility, with bundled service tiers and SLAs aligned to business risk. Regional growth will follow digital transformation intensity, with mid-market acceleration driven by prepackaged testing accelerators.

Looking to 2031, TaaS providers will differentiate through domain expertise, security-by-design practices, and intelligent orchestration that balances speed with resilience. Integrated test data management, privacy-preserving synthetic datasets, and contract testing for distributed systems will be core to scaling quality at pace. Enhanced coverage for mobile, IoT, and AI-enabled applications will elevate real-world scenario validation, while shift-left and shift-right strategies converge into continuous quality engineering. Platform capabilities will emphasize reusable assets, model-based testing, and autonomous test generation that adapts to evolving requirements. Vendor ecosystems will broaden through partnerships with DevOps toolchains, cloud platforms, and observability solutions, ensuring unified workflows and actionable insights. Procurement will move toward transparent metrics tied to customer experience, reliability, and regulatory outcomes. As organizations face talent constraints, TaaS will fill critical skill gaps, enabling pr
